about_speaker: {0: "John Delaney leads the team that is building a cabled network of deep-ocean sensors that will study, over time and space, the way the ocean's complex processes interact. By networking the ocean to gather data, he's helping to revolutionize ocean science."}

speaker: Laurie Santos
about_speaker: {0: 'Laurie Santos studies primate psychology and monkeynomics -- testing problems in human psychology on primates, who (not so surprisingly) have many of the same predictable irrationalities we do.'}

speaker: Lewis Pugh
about_speaker: {0: "Pushing his body through epic cold-water swims, Lewis Gordon Pugh wants to draw attention to our global climate. He's just back from swimming in a meltwater lake on the slopes of Mount Everest. "}

speaker: Jason Clay
about_speaker: {0: 'Jason Clay’s ideas are changing the way governments, foundations, researchers and NGOs identify and address risks and opportunities for their work.'}

speaker: Sheryl WuDunn
about_speaker: {0: 'As a journalist reporting on China, Sheryl WuDunn saw the everyday oppression of women around the world. She and Nick Kristof wrote "Half the Sky," chronicling women\'s stories of horror and, especially, hope.'}

speaker: Peter Molyneux
about_speaker: {0: 'The head of Microsoft\'s European games division, Peter Molyneux is building an astonishing new "virtual friend" who interacts with you.'}

speaker: Jamil Abu-Wardeh
about_speaker: {0: 'Jamil Abu-Wardeh believes in the community-building power of a shared laugh -- especially in Arabic. He jumpstarted the Dubai standup comedy scene and produced the Axis of Evil Middle East Comedy Tour.'}

speaker: Maz Jobrani
about_speaker: {0: 'A founding member of the Axis of Evil Comedy Tour, Iranian-American comedian Maz Jobrani is now touring with his second solo comedy show, Browner and Friendlier.'}

speaker: Seth Priebatsch
about_speaker: {0: '"Proud Princeton dropout" Seth Priebatsch runs SCVNGR, a mobile start-up trying to build the game layer on top of the world.'}

speaker: David McCandless
about_speaker: {0: 'David McCandless draws beautiful conclusions from complex datasets -- thus revealing unexpected insights into our world.'}

speaker: Robert Lee Hotz
about_speaker: {0: 'Robert Lee Hotz is the science columnist for the Wall Street Journal, where he writes about cutting-edge research on climate change, cosmology, molecular medicine, the human brain and much more ... He has traveled three times to the South Pole.'}

speaker: Jim Toomey
about_speaker: {0: 'For the past 13 years, Jim Toomey has been writing and drawing the daily comic strip Sherman’s Lagoon, about a daffy family of ocean dwellers.'}

speaker: Lisa Margonelli
about_speaker: {0: 'Director of the New America Foundation Energy Policy Initiative, Lisa Margonelli writes about the global culture and economy of energy.'}

speaker: Dan Cobley
about_speaker: {0: 'Dan Cobley is a marketing director at Google, where he connects customers and businesses, helping both navigate digital space to find what they need.  '}

speaker: Nic Marks
about_speaker: {0: "Nic Marks gathers evidence about what makes us happy, and uses it to promote policy that puts the well-being of people and the planet first. He's the founder of the Centre for Well-Being at the UK think tank New Economics Foundation (NEF)."}

speaker: Johan Rockstrom
about_speaker: {0: 'Johan Rockström works to redefine sustainable development.'}

speaker: His Holiness the Karmapa
about_speaker: {0: 'Ogyen Trinley Dorje is the 17th Gyalwang Karmapa, a revered figure in Tibetan Buddhism devoted to preserving and propagating Buddhist teachings.'}

speaker: Derek Sivers
about_speaker: {0: 'Through his new project, MuckWork, Derek Sivers wants to lessen the burdens (and boredom) of creative people.'}

speaker: Rachel Sussman
about_speaker: {0: 'Rachel Sussman is on a quest to celebrate the resilience of life by identifying and photographing continuous-living organisms that are 2,000 years or older, all around the world.'}

speaker: Sugata Mitra
about_speaker: {0: 'Educational researcher Sugata Mitra is the winner of the 2013 TED Prize. His wish: Build a School in the Cloud, where children can explore and learn from one another.'}

speaker: Alwar Balasubramaniam
about_speaker: {0: 'Sculptor, painter and printmaker Alwar Balasubramaniam makes work that crosses the boundary between art, perception and life.'}

speaker: Carne Ross
about_speaker: {0: 'Carne Ross is the founder of Independent Diplomat, a nonprofit that offers freelance diplomatic representation to small, developing and yet-unrecognized nations in the complex world of international negotiations.'}

speaker: Ben Cameron
about_speaker: {0: 'Ben Cameron runs the arts granting program at the Doris Duke Foundation, focusing on live theater, dance and jazz.'}

speaker: Rob Dunbar
about_speaker: {0: 'Rob Dunbar looks deeply at ancient corals and sediments to study how the climate and the oceans have shifted over the past 50 to 12,000 years -- and how the Antarctic ecosystem is changing right now.'}

speaker: Chris Anderson
about_speaker: {0: 'After a long career in journalism and publishing, Chris Anderson became the curator of the TED Conference in 2002 and has developed it as a platform for identifying and disseminating ideas worth spreading.'}

speaker: Jessa Gamble
about_speaker: {0: 'Jessa Gamble writes about sleep and time, showing how our internal body clock struggles against our always-on global culture.'}

speaker: Nicholas Christakis
about_speaker: {0: 'Nicholas Christakis explores how the large-scale, face-to-face social networks in which we are embedded affect our lives, and what we can do to take advantage of this fact.'}

speaker: Caroline Phillips
about_speaker: {0: "Caroline Phillips' rich, soprano voice conjures up the far-and-wide cultures of the world, especially the sound and language of the Basque Country."}

speaker: Christien Meindertsma
about_speaker: {0: 'Christien Meindertsma uses art (and craft) to expose the hidden processes and connections of our modern life.'}

speaker: Steven Johnson
about_speaker: {0: 'Steven Berlin Johnson examines the intersection of science, technology and personal experience.'}

speaker: Mitchell Besser
about_speaker: {0: 'How can mothers with HIV avoid passing it to their kids? In South Africa, Mitchell Besser tapped a new resource for healthcare: moms themselves. The program he started, mothers2mothers, trains new mothers to educate and support other moms.'}

speaker: Annie Lennox
about_speaker: {0: 'The most successful female British pop musician in history, Annie Lennox has now committed herself to raising awareness of, and supporting actions against, the HIV/AIDS crisis in Africa.'}

speaker: Fabian Hemmert
about_speaker: {0: "Fabian Hemmert is a design professor, driven by the belief that we shouldn't sacrifice our humanness for the sake of technology."}

speaker: Julian Treasure
about_speaker: {0: 'Julian Treasure studies sound and advises businesses on how best to use it.'}

speaker: Gary Wolf
about_speaker: {0: "Journalist Gary Wolf spends his days in pursuit of the most fascinating things. As a contributing editor at Wired, he's written about technology, mushroom hunters, venture capitalists ..."}

speaker: Sebastian Seung
about_speaker: {0: 'Sebastian Seung is a leader in the new field of connectomics, currently the hottest space in neuroscience, which studies, in once-impossible detail, the wiring of the brain.'}

speaker: Inge Missmahl
about_speaker: {0: 'By building psychosocial care into the primary health care system in Afghanistan, Inge Missmahl offers hope to a society traumatized by decades of conflict and insecurity.'}

speaker: Mechai Viravaidya
about_speaker: {0: 'Since 1974, Mechai Viravaidya has been creating and running innovative family planning and poverty reduction programs throughout Southeast Asia. '}

speaker: Eben Bayer
about_speaker: {0: "Eben Bayer is co-inventor of MycoBond, an organic (really -- it's based on mycelium, a living, growing organism) adhesive that turns agriwaste into a foam-like material for packaging and insulation."}

speaker: Tim Jackson
about_speaker: {0: 'Tim Jackson is a British ecological economist and professor for sustainable development at the University of Surrey. He is the author of "Prosperity without Growth" and director of the Centre for the Understanding of Sustainable Prosperity.'}

speaker: Barbara Block
about_speaker: {0: 'Barbara Block studies how tuna, billfish and sharks move around (and stay warm) in the open ocean. Knowing how these large predators travel through pelagic waters will help us understand their role in the wider ocean ecosystem.'}

speaker: Hans Rosling
about_speaker: {0: 'In Hans Rosling’s hands, data sings. Global trends in health and economics come to vivid life. And the big picture of global development -- with some surprisingly good news -- snaps into sharp focus.'}

speaker: Stacey Kramer
about_speaker: {0: 'Stacey Kramer has traveled the United States and the world helping to create names and brands for growing companies.'}

speaker: Stefano Mancuso
about_speaker: {0: 'Stefano Mancuso is a founder of the study of plant neurobiology, which explores signaling and communication at all levels of biological organization, from genetics to molecules, cells and ecological communities.'}

speaker: Melinda Gates
about_speaker: {0: 'Melinda French Gates is co-chair of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, where she puts into practice the idea that every life has equal value.'}

speaker: Peter Haas
about_speaker: {0: 'Inveterate tinkerer Peter Haas is the co-founder of AIDG, the Appropriate Infrastructure Development Group, which connect people to electricity, sanitation and clean water through a combination of business incubation, education, and outreach.'}

speaker: Natalie Jeremijenko
about_speaker: {0: 'Natalie Jeremijenko blends art, engineering, environmentalism, biochemistry and more to create real-life experiments that enable social change. '}

speaker: Ze Frank
about_speaker: {0: 'Ze Frank has been involved in online comedy, web toys and virtually shared experiences for the past 20 years as an influencer, performer, executive and mischief maker.'}

speaker: Jessica Jackley
about_speaker: {0: 'Jessica Jackley is the co-founder of Kiva.org, an online community that helps individuals loan small amounts of money, called microloans, to entrepreneurs throughout the world.'}

speaker: Heribert Watzke
about_speaker: {0: 'Heribert Watzke studies the brain in our gut -- and works to develop new kinds of food that will satisfy our bodies and minds.'}

speaker: Dianna Cohen
about_speaker: {0: 'Dianna Cohen co-founded the Plastic Pollution Coalition, which is working to help end our cycle of plastics use.'}

speaker: Patrick Chappatte
about_speaker: {0: "With simple lines and pointed jokes that skewer injustice, Patrick Chappatte's editorial cartoons view the tragic, the farcical and the absurd through a lens of unfettered humor."}

speaker: Thomas Dolby
about_speaker: {0: 'Thomas Dolby has spent his career at the intersection of music and technology. He was an early star on MTV, then moved to Silicon Valley, then went back on the road with his album, "A Map of the Floating City."', 1: 'Ethel is, perhaps, the first 21st-century realization of the classical string quartet. ', 2: 'David Byrne builds an idiosyncratic world of music, art, writing and film.'}

speaker: R.A. Mashelkar
about_speaker: {0: 'Using a principle he calls “convex lens leadership,” R.A. Mashelkar’s vision has catapulted india’s talent for science and innovation onto the international stage.'}

speaker: Joseph Nye
about_speaker: {0: "The former assistant secretary of defense and former dean of Harvard's Kennedy School of Government, Joseph Nye offers sharp insights into the way nations take and cede power."}

speaker: Barton Seaver
about_speaker: {0: 'Barton Seaver is an advocate of sustainable seafood and a chef in Washington DC. His work tells the story of our common resources through the communion we all share – dinner.'}

speaker: Shimon Steinberg
about_speaker: {0: "Shimon Steinberg's biotech lab researches ways to harness the natural benefits of insects on a massive scale."}

speaker: Miwa Matreyek
about_speaker: {0: 'Miwa Matreyek creates performances where real shapes and virtual images trade places, amid layers of animation, video and live bodies.'}

speaker: Tom Chatfield
about_speaker: {0: "Tom Chatfield thinks about games -- what we want from them, what we get from them, and how we might use our hard-wired desire for a gamer's reward to change the way we learn."}

speaker: David Bismark
about_speaker: {0: 'David Bismark has co-developed an electronic voting system that contains a simple and reliable method of verification.'}

speaker: Gero Miesenboeck
about_speaker: {0: 'Using light and a little genetic engineering -- optogenetics -- Gero Miesenboeck has developed a way to control how living nerve cells work, and advanced understanding of how the brain controls behavior.'}

speaker: Greg Stone
about_speaker: {0: 'Greg Stone was a key driver in the establishment of the Phoenix Island Protected Area in the island nation of Kiribati. The second-largest marine protected area in the world -- and one of the most pristine -- PIPA is a laboratory for exploring and monitoring the recovery of coral reefs from bleaching events.'}

speaker: Andrew Bird
about_speaker: {0: 'Andrew Bird is a virtual one-man band -- he’s a singer and songwriter and plays the violin, guitar, glockenspiel.'}

speaker: Emily Pilloton
about_speaker: {0: "Emily Pilloton wrote Design Revolution, a book about 100-plus objects and systems designed to make people's lives better. In 2010, her design nonprofit began an immersive residency in Bertie County, North Carolina, the poorest and most rural county in the state."}

speaker: Stefan Wolff
about_speaker: {0: 'Stefan Wolff studies contemporary conflicts, focusing on the prevention and settlement of ethnic conflicts and in postconflict reconstruction in deeply divided and war-torn societies.'}

speaker: Aaron Huey
about_speaker: {0: 'Photographer, adventurer and storyteller Aaron Huey captures all of his subjects -- from war victims to rock climbers to Sufi dervishes -- with elegance and fearless sensitivity.'}

speaker: Auret van Heerden
about_speaker: {0: "At the head of the Fair Labor Association (FLA), Auret van Heerden takes a practical approach to workers' rights, persuading corporations and NGOs to protect labor in global supply chains."}

speaker: Eric Berlow
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Senior Fellow Eric Berlow studies ecology and networks, exposing the interconnectedness of our ecosystems with climate change, government, corporations and more.  '}

speaker: Conrad Wolfram
about_speaker: {0: 'Conrad Wolfram runs the worldwide arm of Wolfram Research, the mathematical lab behind the cutting-edge knowledge engine Wolfram Alpha.'}

speaker: Denis Dutton
about_speaker: {0: 'Denis Dutton was a philosophy professor and the editor of Arts & Letters Daily. In his book The Art Instinct, he suggested that humans are hard-wired to seek beauty.'}

speaker: Shimon Schocken
about_speaker: {0: 'Shimon Schocken is a computer science professor and dedicated educator.'}

speaker: John Hardy
about_speaker: {0: 'Jewelry designer John Hardy co-founded the extraordinary Green School in Bali, where kids get a holistic and green education.'}

speaker: Kristina Gjerde
about_speaker: {0: "Kristina Gjerde is an expert on the law of the high seas -- the vast areas of the sea and seabed that exist beyond any national jurisdiction. These places belong to the world; Gjerde's work helps the world work together to protect them."}

speaker: Kim Gorgens
about_speaker: {0: "Kim Gorgens studies the brain's response to injury -- and advocates that we mind our (gray) matter."}

speaker: Zainab Salbi
about_speaker: {0: 'Iraqi-born Zainab Salbi founded and runs Women for Women International, and has dedicated her life to helping women in war-torn regions rebuild their lives and communities.'}

speaker: Jason Fried
about_speaker: {0: 'Jason Fried thinks deeply about collaboration, productivity and the nature of work. He\'s the co-founder of 37signals, makers of Basecamp and other web-based collaboration tools, and co-author of "Rework."'}

speaker: Dan Phillips
about_speaker: {0: 'Dan Phillips builds homes out of recycled and reclaimed materials in Huntsville, Texas.'}

speaker: Birke Baehr
about_speaker: {0: "Birke Baehr wants us to know how our food is made, where it comes from, and what's in it. At age 11, he's planning a career as an organic farmer."}

speaker: William Ury
about_speaker: {0: 'William Ury is a mediator, writer and speaker, working with conflicts ranging from family feuds to boardroom battles to ethnic wars. He\'s the author of "Getting to Yes."'}

speaker: Marcel Dicke
about_speaker: {0: 'Marcel Dicke wants us to reconsider our relationship with insects, promoting bugs as a tasty -- and ecologically sound -- alternative to meat in an increasingly hungry world.'}

speaker: Bart Weetjens
about_speaker: {0: 'The founder of Apopo, Bart Weet\xadjens, is train\xading rats to detect landmine explosives in minute amounts.'}

speaker: Arthur Potts Dawson
about_speaker: {0: "Arthur Potts Dawson wants us to take responsibility not just for the food we eat, but how we shop for and even dispose of it. And he's showing the way -- with impeccable taste."}

speaker: Halla Tómasdóttir
about_speaker: {0: 'Halla Tómasdóttir is the CEO of The B Team, a group of global leaders working together to transform business for a better world.'}

speaker: Tony Porter
about_speaker: {0: 'Tony Porter is an educator and activist who is internationally recognized for his effort to end violence against women.'}

speaker: Kiran Bedi
about_speaker: {0: "Kiran Bedi was one of India's top cops -- tough, innovative and committed to social change. Now retired from the national police force, Bedi runs two NGOs that benefit rural and urban poor. "}

speaker: Hanna Rosin
about_speaker: {0: 'Hanna Rosin isn’t afraid to shine a skeptical spotlight on people’s cherished ideals, whether it’s politically correct dogma or the conservative Christian agenda.'}

speaker: Diana Laufenberg
about_speaker: {0: 'For over 15 years Diana has been a secondary social studies teacher in Wisconsin, Kansas, Arizona and Pennsylvania.'}

speaker: Rufus Griscom + Alisa Volkman
about_speaker: {0: 'Rufus Griscom and Alisa Volkman co-founded Babble, a website for parents. They have three sons.'}

speaker: Rachel Botsman
about_speaker: {0: 'Rachel Botsman is a recognized expert on how collaboration and trust enabled by digital technologies will change the way we live, work, bank and consume.'}

speaker: Beverly + Dereck Joubert
about_speaker: {0: 'Documentary filmmakers Beverly and Dereck Joubert have worked to conserve wildlife for more than 25 years. As National Geographic Explorers in Residence, the couple influences public policy and perceptions.'}

speaker: Sheryl Sandberg
about_speaker: {0: 'As the COO at the helm of Facebook, Sheryl Sandberg juggles the tasks of monetizing the world’s largest social networking site while keeping its users happy and engaged.'}

speaker: Majora Carter
about_speaker: {0: 'Majora Carter redefined the field of environmental equality, starting in the South Bronx at the turn of the century.  Now she is leading the local economic development movement across the USA.'}

speaker: Brené Brown
about_speaker: {0: 'Brené Brown studies vulnerability, courage, authenticity and shame.'}

speaker: Barry Schwartz
about_speaker: {0: "Barry Schwartz studies the link between economics and psychology, offering startling insights into modern life. Lately, working with Ken Sharpe, he's studying wisdom."}

speaker: Arianna Huffington
about_speaker: {0: 'Arianna Huffington is the co-founder and former editor-in-chief of The Huffington Post, a nationally syndicated columnist, and author of thirteen books. She is the co-host of “Left, Right & Center,” a political roundtable radio program.'}

speaker: Lesley Hazleton
about_speaker: {0: 'Writer, psychologist and former Middle East reporter Lesley Hazleton explores the vast and often terrifying arena in which politics and religion intersect. '}

speaker: Charles Limb
about_speaker: {0: 'Charles Limb is a doctor and a musician who researches the way musical creativity works in the brain.'}

speaker: Deborah Rhodes
about_speaker: {0: 'Deborah Rhodes is an expert at managing breast-cancer risk. The director of the Mayo Clinic’s Executive Health Program is now testing a gamma camera that can see tumors that get missed by mammography.'}

speaker: Neil Pasricha
about_speaker: {0: "Neil Pasricha is one of the world's leading authorities on intentional living."}

speaker: Jody Williams
about_speaker: {0: 'Jody Williams won a Nobel Peace Prize for her efforts to eradicate landmines. Now she’s teaming up with five other female peace laureates to empower women to fight violence, injustice and inequality.'}

speaker: Amber Case
about_speaker: {0: 'Amber Case studies the symbiotic interactions between humans and machines -- and considers how our values and culture are being shaped by living lives increasingly mediated by high technology. '}

speaker: Thomas Thwaites
about_speaker: {0: 'Thomas Thwaites is a designer "of a more speculative sort," he says.'}

speaker: Elizabeth Lesser
about_speaker: {0: "Elizabeth Lesser helps her readers and students transform their lives after brushes with pain, adversity and life's myriad problems."}

speaker: Ali Carr-Chellman
about_speaker: {0: 'Ali Carr-Chellman is an instructional designer and author who studies the most effective ways to teach kids and to make changes at school.'}

speaker: Naomi Klein
about_speaker: {0: 'Naomi Klein is a public intellectual, journalist and activist.'}

speaker: Charity Tillemann-Dick
about_speaker: {0: 'Charity Tillemann-Dick was a soprano who appeared on opera and concert stages around the world. Her roles included Titania in "A Midsummer\'s Night Dream," Gilda in "Rigoletto" and Violetta in "La Traviata."'}

speaker: Van Jones
about_speaker: {0: 'Van Jones sees a clear link between social justice and green energy -- and works for both.'}

speaker: Anders Ynnerman
about_speaker: {0: 'Anders Ynnerman studies the fundamental aspects of computer graphics and visualization, in particular large scale and complex data sets with a focus on volume rendering and multi-modal interaction. '}

speaker: Heather Knight
about_speaker: {0: 'Heather Knight runs Marilyn Monrobot, which creates socially intelligent robot performances and sensor-based electronic art. (and she helped build the amazing Rube Goldberg machine for OK Go’s “This Too Shall Pass.")'}

speaker: Martin Jacques
about_speaker: {0: 'Martin Jacques is the author of "When China Rules the World," and a columnist for the Guardian and New Statesman. He was a co-founder of the think tank Demos.'}

speaker: Thomas Goetz
about_speaker: {0: 'Thomas Goetz is the co-founder of Iodine and author of "The Decision Tree: Taking Control of Your Health in the New Era of Personalized Medicine.”'}

speaker: Liza Donnelly
about_speaker: {0: 'New Yorker cartoonist Liza Donnelly tackles global issues with humor, intelligence and sarcasm. Her latest project supports the United Nations initiative Cartooning For Peace. '}

speaker: Ariel Garten
about_speaker: {0: 'As CEO of InteraXon, Ariel Garten works to close the gap between science, art, business and technology.'}

speaker: Bruce Feiler
about_speaker: {0: 'Bruce Feiler is the author of "The Secrets of Happy Families," and the writer/presenter of the PBS miniseries "Walking the Bible."'}

speaker: Kate Orff
about_speaker: {0: 'Kate Orff asks us to rethink “landscape”—to use urban greenspaces and blue spaces in fresh ways to mediate between humankind and nature.'}

speaker: Dale Dougherty
about_speaker: {0: "A technology and publishing enthusiast, Dale Dougherty founded MAKE magazine and created the world's largest DIY festival, Maker Faire."}

speaker: Johanna Blakley
about_speaker: {0: 'Johanna Blakley studies the impact of mass media and entertainment on our world.'}

speaker: Christopher McDougall
about_speaker: {0: 'Christopher McDougall is the author of "Born to Run: A Hidden Tribe, Super Athletes, and the Greatest Race the World Has Never Seen."'}

speaker: Suheir Hammad
about_speaker: {0: 'In her poems and plays, Suheir Hammad blends the stories and sounds of her Palestinian-American heritage with the vibrant language of Brooklyn to create a passionately modern voice.'}

speaker: Nigel Marsh
about_speaker: {0: 'Nigel Marsh presents and writes on business and personal life -- and how the two interact. He is the author of "Fat, Forty and Fired."'}

speaker: Cynthia Breazeal
about_speaker: {0: 'At MIT, Cynthia Breazeal and her team are building robots with social intelligence that communicate and learn the same way people do. \r\n'}

speaker: Dr. Hawa Abdi + Dr. Deqo Mohamed
about_speaker: {0: 'Dr. Hawa Abdi and her daughters, Dr. Deqo Mohamed and Dr. Amina Mohamed, treat Somali refugee women and children, often for free.'}

speaker: Michael Pawlyn
about_speaker: {0: 'Michael Pawlyn takes cues from nature to make new, sustainable architectural environments.'}

speaker: Geert Chatrou
about_speaker: {0: "It all started as a practical joke: Geert Chatrou's sister-in-law entered him in the International Whistler's Convention in Louisburg, NC. To save face, he went … and won!"}

speaker: Krista Tippett
about_speaker: {0: 'Krista Tippett hosts the national public radio program "On Being," which takes up the great, animating questions of human life: What does it mean to be human? And how do we want to live?'}

speaker: Patricia Kuhl
about_speaker: {0: 'Patricia Kuhl studies how we learn language as babies, looking at the ways our brains form around language acquisition.'}

speaker: Jacqueline Novogratz
about_speaker: {0: 'Jacqueline Novogratz works to enable human flourishing. Her organization, Acumen, invests in people, companies and ideas that see capital and networks as means, not ends, to solving the toughest issues of poverty.'}

speaker: Lisa Gansky
about_speaker: {0: 'Lisa Gansky is the author of "The Mesh: Why the Future of Business Is Sharing," and the instigator behind the Mesh Directory (www.meshing.it).'}

speaker: Madeleine Albright
about_speaker: {0: 'Since leaving office as US Secretary of State in 2001, Madeleine Albright has continued her distinguished career in foreign affairs as a businesswoman, political adviser and professor. '}

speaker: Noreena Hertz
about_speaker: {0: 'Noreena Hertz looks at global culture -- financial and otherwise -- using an approach that combines traditional economic analysis with foreign policy trends, psychology, behavioural economics, anthropology, history and sociology.'}

speaker: Iain Hutchison
about_speaker: {0: 'Iain Hutchison is a pioneering oral and facial surgeon; his foundation, Saving Faces, explores the nature of our expressions.'}

speaker: Elizabeth Lindsey
about_speaker: {0: 'Elizabeth Lindsey is a fellow of the National Geographic Society. Her mission: to keep ancestral voices alive by recording indigenous wisdom and traditions.'}

speaker: Danny Hillis
about_speaker: {0: 'Inventor, scientist, author, engineer -- over his broad career, Danny Hillis has turned his ever-searching brain on an array of subjects, with surprising results.'}

speaker: Ahn Trio
about_speaker: {0: 'With cello, piano and violin, sisters Maria, Lucia and Angella Ahn are constantly redefining the art and architecture of chamber music. '}

speaker: Wadah Khanfar
about_speaker: {0: 'As the Director General of Al Jazeera from 2003-2011, Wadah Khanfar worked to bring rare liberties like information, transparency and dissenting voices to repressive states and political hot zones.'}

speaker: JR
about_speaker: {0: 'With a camera, a dedicated wheatpasting crew and the help of whole villages and favelas, 2011 TED Prize winner JR shows the world its true face.'}

speaker: Wael Ghonim
about_speaker: {0: 'Wael Ghonim believes that the Internet can be the most powerful platform for connecting humanity, if we can bring civility and thoughtful conversations back to it.'}

speaker: Bill Gates
about_speaker: {0: "A passionate techie and a shrewd businessman, Bill Gates changed the world while leading Microsoft to dizzying success. Now he's doing it again with his own style of philanthropy and passion for innovation."}

speaker: Anthony Atala
about_speaker: {0: 'Anthony Atala asks, "Can we grow organs instead of transplanting them?" His lab at the Wake Forest Institute for Regenerative Medicine is doing just that -- engineering over 30 tissues and whole organs.'}

speaker: Courtney E. Martin
about_speaker: {0: 'Courtney E. Martin’s work has two obsessions at its core: storytelling and solutions. '}

speaker: Sal Khan
about_speaker: {0: 'In 2004, Sal Khan, a hedge fund analyst, began making math tutorials for his cousins. Twelve years later, Khan Academy has more than 42 million registered users from 190 countries, with tutorials on subjects from basic math through economics, art history, computer science, health, medicine and more.'}

speaker: Deb Roy
about_speaker: {0: "Deb Roy studies how children learn language, and designs machines that learn to communicate in human-like ways. On sabbatical from MIT Media Lab, he's working with the AI company Bluefin Labs."}

speaker: Rob Harmon
about_speaker: {0: 'Rob Harmon is an expert on energy and natural resources policy -- looking at smart ways to manage carbon, water and the energy we use every day.'}

speaker: David Brooks
about_speaker: {0: 'Writer and thinker David Brooks has covered business, crime and politics over a long career in journalism. '}

speaker: Janna Levin
about_speaker: {0: 'Janna Levin is a professor of physics and astronomy at Barnard, where she studies the early universe, chaos, and black holes. She\'s the author of  “How the Universe Got Its Spots" and the novel “A Madman Dreams of Turing Machines.”'}

speaker: Mark Bezos
about_speaker: {0: 'Mark Bezos works at Robin Hood, a poverty-fighting charity in New York City, and the assistant captain of a volunteer fire company in suburban New York.'}

speaker: Rogier van der Heide
about_speaker: {0: 'Rogier van der Heide creates architectural spaces with light.'}

speaker: Sarah Kay
about_speaker: {0: 'Sarah Kay is a poet, performer, educator and the founder of Project VOICE, an organization that uses spoken word poetry to entertain, educate and empower students and teachers worldwide.'}

speaker: Hans Rosling
about_speaker: {0: 'In Hans Rosling’s hands, data sings. Global trends in health and economics come to vivid life. And the big picture of global development -- with some surprisingly good news -- snaps into sharp focus.'}

speaker: Isabel Behncke
about_speaker: {0: 'Isabel Behncke applies an evolutionary lens to human questions like: Why do we play?'}

speaker: Paul Root Wolpe
about_speaker: {0: "Paul Root Wolpe examines the ethical implications of new science -- genetic modification, neuroscience and other breakthroughs that stretch our current philosophy to the breaking point. He's the chief bioethicist at NASA, among other appointments."}

speaker: Eythor Bender
about_speaker: {0: 'Eythor Bender is the CEO of Berkeley Bionics, which augments humans with wearable, powered and artificially intelligent devices called exoskeletons or "wearable robots."'}

speaker: Claron McFadden
about_speaker: {0: 'Amsterdam-based singer Claron McFadden sings many of the major oratorio works, but is perhaps best known for her readings of modern and contemporary music.'}

speaker: Patricia Ryan
about_speaker: {0: 'Patricia Ryan has spent the past three-plus decades teaching English in Arabic countries -- where she has seen vast cultural (and linguistic) change.'}

speaker: Ralph Langner
about_speaker: {0: 'Ralph Langner is a German control system security consultant. He has received worldwide recognition for his analysis of the Stuxnet malware.'}

speaker: Handspring Puppet Company
about_speaker: {0: 'Basil Jones and Adrian Kohler, of Handspring Puppet Company, bring the emotional complexity of animals to the stage with their life-size puppets. Their latest triumph: "War Horse."'}

speaker: Sebastian Thrun
about_speaker: {0: 'Sebastian Thrun is a passionate technologist who is constantly looking for new opportunities to make the world better for all of us.'}

speaker: Eric Whitacre
about_speaker: {0: 'After creating and conducting a worldwide virtual choir on YouTube, Eric Whitacre is now touring with an astonishing live choir.'}

speaker: AnnMarie Thomas
about_speaker: {0: 'AnnMarie Thomas works on the playful side of engineering -- using cool tools to teach and help others.'}

speaker: Stanley McChrystal
about_speaker: {0: 'General Stanley McChrystal is the former commander of U.S. and International forces in Afghanistan. A four-star general, he is credited for creating a revolution in warfare that fuses intelligence and operations.'}

speaker: Chade-Meng Tan
about_speaker: {0: "One of Google's earliest engineers, Chade-Meng Tan is now Google's Jolly Good Fellow -- the head of personal growth at the groundbreaking search company."}

speaker: Morgan Spurlock
about_speaker: {0: 'Morgan Spurlock makes documentary film and TV that is personal, political -- and, above all, deeply empathetic.'}

speaker: Mick Ebeling
about_speaker: {0: 'Mick Ebeling founded the Not Impossible Foundation, a nonprofit that develops creative solutions to real-world problems.'}

speaker: Caroline Casey
about_speaker: {0: 'Caroline Casey works relentlessly to bring out a global shift in business inclusion, and ensure that everyone can live their life without limit or labels.'}

speaker: Jackson Browne
about_speaker: {0: 'Jackson Browne has written and performed some of the most literate and moving songs in popular music -- and has defined a genre of songwriting charged with honesty, emotion and personal politics.'}

speaker: David Christian
about_speaker: {0: 'David Christian teaches an ambitious world history course that tells the tale of the entire universe -- from the Big Bang 13 billion years ago to present day.'}

speaker: Dave Meslin
about_speaker: {0: 'Dave Meslin is a "professional rabble-rouser." Based in Toronto, he works to make local issues engaging and even fun to get involved in.'}

speaker: Roger Ebert
about_speaker: {0: 'After losing the power to speak, legendary film critic Roger Ebert went on to write about creativity, race, politics and culture -- and film, just as brilliantly as ever.'}

speaker: Marcin Jakubowski
about_speaker: {0: 'Marcin Jakubowski is open-sourcing a set of blueprints for 50 farming tools that can be built cheaply from scratch. Call it a "civilization starter kit."'}

speaker: Susan Lim
about_speaker: {0: 'A surgical pioneer in Singapore, Susan Lim is a researcher and entrepreneur.'}

speaker: Sam Richards
about_speaker: {0: 'Sam Richards is a sociologist and teacher of the largest race relations course in the US. He argues that empathy is the core of sociology.'}

speaker: Kathryn Schulz
about_speaker: {0: 'Kathryn Schulz is a staff writer for the New Yorker and is the author of "Being Wrong: Adventures in the Margin of Error."'}

speaker: John Hunter
about_speaker: {0: 'Teacher and musician John Hunter is the inventor of the World Peace Game (and the star of the documentary "World Peace and Other 4th-Grade Achievements").'}

speaker: Anil Ananthaswamy
about_speaker: {0: 'Anil Ananthaswamy specializes in writing about neuroscience and physics. He is the author of "The Man Who Wasn’t There," "The Edge of Physics" and the forthcoming "Through Two Doors at Once."'}

speaker: Ric Elias
about_speaker: {0: 'Ric Elias is the CEO and cofounder of Red Ventures, a portfolio of fast-growing digital businesses.'}

speaker: Harvey Fineberg
about_speaker: {0: 'Harvey Fineberg studies medical decisionmaking -- from how we roll out new medical technology, to how we cope with new illnesses and threatened epidemics.'}

speaker: Bruce Schneier
about_speaker: {0: 'Bruce Schneier thinks hard about security -- as a computer security guru, and as a philosopher of the larger notion of making a safer world. '}

speaker: Angela Belcher
about_speaker: {0: 'Angela Belcher looks to nature for inspiration on how to engineer viruses to create extraordinary new materials.'}

speaker: Mike Matas
about_speaker: {0: "While at Apple, Mike Matas helped write the user interface for the iPhone and iPad. Now with Push Pop Press, he's helping to rewrite the electronic book."}

speaker: Arvind Gupta
about_speaker: {0: 'Science educator Arvind Gupta uses simple toys to teach.'}

speaker: Aicha el-Wafi + Phyllis Rodriguez
about_speaker: {0: 'Aicha el-Wafi and Phyllis Rodriguez met around a shared tragedy -- and their friendship has become a powerful symbol for forgiveness and dialogue.'}

speaker: Eli Pariser
about_speaker: {0: 'As a cofounder of Upworthy, and the author of "The Filter Bubble," Eli Pariser leverages technology to help build better and more democratic societies.'}

speaker: Carlo Ratti
about_speaker: {0: 'Carlo Ratti directs the MIT SENSEable City Lab, which explores the "real-time city" by studying the way sensors and electronics relate to the built environment. '}

speaker: Suzanne Lee
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Fellow Suzanne Lee is a fashion designer turned biofabrication pioneer who is nurturing a global community of innovators growing materials.'}

speaker: Sean M Carroll
about_speaker: {0: 'A physicist, cosmologist and gifted science communicator, Sean Carroll is asking himself -- and asking us to consider -- questions that get at the fundamental nature of the universe.'}

speaker: Louie Schwartzberg
about_speaker: {0: 'Louie Schwartzberg is a cinematographer, director and producer who captures breathtaking images that celebrate life -- revealing connections, universal rhythms, patterns and beauty.'}

speaker: Paul Nicklen
about_speaker: {0: 'Paul Nicklen photographs the creatures of the Arctic and Antarctic, generating global awareness about wildlife in these isolated and endangered environments.'}

speaker: Fiorenzo Omenetto
about_speaker: {0: "Fiorenzo G. Omenetto's research spans nonlinear optics, nanostructured materials (such as photonic crystals and photonic crystal fibers), biomaterials and biopolymer-based photonics. Most recently, he's working on high-tech applications for silk."}

speaker: Ron Gutman
about_speaker: {0: "Ron Gutman is the founder and former CEO of HealthTap, free mobile and online apps for health info. He's also the organizer of TEDxSiliconValley."}

speaker: Amit Sood
about_speaker: {0: "As the director of Google's Cultural Institute and Art Project, Amit Sood leads the effort to bring cultural artifacts from museums, archives and foundations onto the web in extraordinary detail."}

speaker: Leonard Susskind
about_speaker: {0: 'Leonard Susskind works on string theory, quantum field theory, quantum statistical mechanics and quantum cosmology at Stanford.'}

speaker: Ed Boyden
about_speaker: {0: 'Ed Boyden is a professor of biological engineering and brain and cognitive sciences at the MIT Media Lab and the MIT McGovern Institute.'}

speaker: Thomas Heatherwick
about_speaker: {0: 'Thomas Heatherwick is the founder of Heatherwick Studio, an architecture and design firm that, among other projects, designed the astonishing "Seed Cathedral" for the UK Pavilion at Shanghai Expo 2010.'}

speaker: Elliot Krane
about_speaker: {0: "At the Lucile Packard Children's Hospital at Stanford, Elliot Krane works on the problem of treating pain in children."}

speaker: Edith Widder
about_speaker: {0: 'Edith Widder combines her expertise in research and technological innovation with a commitment to stopping and reversing the degradation of our marine environment. '}

speaker: Terry Moore
about_speaker: {0: 'Terry Moore is the director of the Radius Foundation, a forum for exploring and gaining insight from different worldviews.'}

speaker: Aaron Koblin
about_speaker: {0: 'Aaron Koblin is an artist specializing in data and digital technologies. His work takes real world and community-generated data and uses it to reflect on cultural trends and the changing relationship between humans and technology.'}

speaker: Bruce Aylward
about_speaker: {0: 'As the Assistant Director-General of the World Health Organization’s Polio and Emergencies Cluster, Bruce Aylward works to ensure that polio stays under control and that the world is prepared to respond to health crises.'}

speaker: Shirin Neshat
about_speaker: {0: 'Shirin Neshat has lived much of her life outside her native Iran. Her photographs and films offer a glimpse of the cultural, religious and political realities that shape the identities of Muslim women worldwide.\r\n'}

speaker: Mustafa Akyol
about_speaker: {0: "Mustafa Akyol is a columnist for Turkey's oldest English-language daily, Hurriyet Daily News."}

speaker: Robert Gupta
about_speaker: {0: "Violinist Robert Gupta joined the LA Philharmonic at the age of 19 -- and maintains a passionate parallel interest in neurobiology and mental health issues. He's a TED Senior Fellow.", 1: 'Joshua Roman is an internationally recognized cellist. '}

speaker: Dennis Hong
about_speaker: {0: 'Dennis Hong is the founder and director of RoMeLa -- a Virginia Tech robotics lab that has pioneered several breakthroughs in robot design and engineering. '}

speaker: Stefan Sagmeister
about_speaker: {0: 'Renowned for album covers, posters and his recent book of life lessons, designer Stefan Sagmeister invariably has a slightly different way of looking at things.'}

speaker: Aaron O'Connell
about_speaker: {0: "Aaron O'Connell is the first person to experimentally induce and measure quantum effects in the motion of a humanmade object, bridging the quantum and classical worlds."}

speaker: Jessi Arrington
about_speaker: {0: 'Jessi Arrington is a color-loving designer based in Brooklyn.'}

speaker: Damon Horowitz
about_speaker: {0: 'Damon Horowitz explores what is possible at the boundaries of technology and the humanities.'}

speaker: Jack Horner
about_speaker: {0: "Jack Horner and his dig teams have discovered the first evidence of parental care in dinosaurs, extensive nesting grounds, evidence of dinosaur herds, and the world’s first dinosaur embryos. He's now exploring how to build a dinosaur."}

speaker: Janet Echelman
about_speaker: {0: 'American artist Janet Echelman reshapes urban airspace with monumental, fluidly moving sculpture that responds to environmental forces including wind, water, and sunlight.'}

speaker: Paul Romer
occupation: {0: ['chief economist and senior vice president', 'world bank']}
about_speaker: {0: "Paul Romer's research on catch-up growth in low- and middle-income countries has emphasized the importance of government policies that encourage orderly urban expansion."}

speaker: Alice Dreger
about_speaker: {0: 'Alice Dreger studies history and anatomy, and acts as a patient advocate.'}

speaker: JD Schramm
about_speaker: {0: 'JD Schramm teaches future business leaders both the theoretical and practical aspects of communication.'}

speaker: Daniel Kraft
about_speaker: {0: 'Daniel Kraft explores the impact and potential of rapidly developing technologies as applied to health and medicine.'}

speaker: Shea Hembrey
about_speaker: {0: 'Shea Hembrey explores patterns from nature and myth. A childhood love of nature, and especially birdlife, informs his vision.'}

speaker: Steve Keil
about_speaker: {0: 'Based in Bulgaria, Steve Keil creates companies around big social and environmental goals.'}

speaker: Camille Seaman
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Senior Fellow Camille Seaman photographs big ice and big clouds.'}

speaker: Onyx Ashanti
about_speaker: {0: 'Onyx Ashanti is the inventor of "beatjazz" -- a new way to make music.'}

speaker: Maya Beiser
about_speaker: {0: 'Maya Beiser commissions and performs radical new work for the cello. '}

speaker: Bill Ford
about_speaker: {0: 'As executive chair of the Ford Motor Company, Bill Ford leads the company that put the world on wheels.'}

speaker: Daniel Tammet
about_speaker: {0: 'Daniel Tammet is the author of "Born on a Blue Day," about his life with high-functioning autistic savant syndrome. He runs the language-learning site Optimnem, and his new book is "Embracing the Wide Sky: A Tour Across the Horizons of the Mind."'}

speaker: Jok Church
about_speaker: {0: 'Jok Church created the science-education comic strip "You Can with Beakman and Jax" and the zany TV series "Beakman\'s World."'}

speaker: Honor Harger
about_speaker: {0: 'Honor Harger explores the sounds of the sky, using art to connect her audience to the universe.'}

speaker: Joshua Walters
about_speaker: {0: 'Joshua Walters is a bipolar comedian whose work explores language, creativity, beatboxing and madness ...'}

speaker: Rajesh Rao
about_speaker: {0: 'Rajesh Rao seeks to understand the human brain through computational modeling, on two fronts: developing computer models of our minds, and using tech to decipher the 4,000-year-old lost script of the Indus Valley civilization.\r\n'}

speaker: Dave deBronkart
about_speaker: {0: 'Dave deBronkart wants to help patients help themselves -- by owning their medical data, connecting to fellow patients and making medical care better.'}

speaker: Robert Hammond
about_speaker: {0: 'The co-founder of Friends of the High Line, Robert Hammond helped lead the effort to build an elevated park on an abandoned railway line in Manhattan.'}

speaker: Matt Cutts
about_speaker: {0: 'An early employee at Google, Matt Cutts works to modernize the US government as an administrator at U.S. Digital Service (USDS).'}

speaker: Nathan Myhrvold
about_speaker: {0: "Nathan Myhrvold is a professional jack-of-all-trades. After leaving Microsoft in 1999, he's been a world barbecue champion, a wildlife photographer, a chef, a contributor to SETI, and a volcano explorer."}

speaker: Jonathan Drori
about_speaker: {0: "Jonathan Drori commissioned the BBC's very first websites, one highlight in a long career devoted to online culture and educational media -- and understanding how we learn."}

speaker: Simon Lewis
about_speaker: {0: 'Simon Lewis is the author of "Rise and Shine," a memoir about his remarkable recovery from a car accident and coma, and his new approach to our own consciousness.'}

speaker: Nina Tandon
about_speaker: {0: 'Nina Tandon studies ways to use electrical signals to grow artificial tissues for transplants and other therapies.'}

speaker: Rebecca MacKinnon
about_speaker: {0: 'Rebecca MacKinnon looks at issues of free expression, governance and democracy (or lack of) in the digital networks, platforms and services on which we are all more and more dependent.'}

speaker: Maajid Nawaz
about_speaker: {0: 'Maajid Nawaz works to promote conversation, tolerance and democracy in Muslim and non-Muslim communities.'}

speaker: Tim Harford
about_speaker: {0: "Tim Harford's writings reveal the economic ideas behind everyday experiences."}

speaker: Nadia Al-Sakkaf
about_speaker: {0: 'Nadia Al-Sakkaf is the editor-in-chief of the Yemen Times, the most widely read English-language newspaper in Yemen.'}

speaker: Mikko Hypponen
about_speaker: {0: "As computer access expands, Mikko Hypponen asks: What's the next killer virus, and will the world be able to cope with it? And also: How can we protect digital privacy in the age of government surveillance?"}

speaker: Thandie Newton
about_speaker: {0: 'Swinging from Hollywood blockbusters to sensitive indie films, Thandie Newton brings thoughtfulness and delicate beauty to her work. '}

speaker: Kevin Slavin
about_speaker: {0: 'Kevin Slavin navigates in the algoworld, the expanding space in our lives that’s determined and run by algorithms.'}

speaker: Markus Fischer
about_speaker: {0: 'Markus Fischer led the team at Festo that developed the first ultralight artificial bird capable of flying like a real bird.'}

speaker: Rory Stewart
about_speaker: {0: 'Rory Stewart -- a perpetual pedestrian, a diplomat, an adventurer and an author -- is the member of British Parliament for Penrith and the Border.'}

speaker: Geoffrey West
about_speaker: {0: 'Physicist Geoffrey West believes that complex systems from organisms to cities are in many ways governed by simple laws -- laws that can be discovered and analyzed.'}

speaker: Paul Bloom
about_speaker: {0: 'Paul Bloom explores some of the most puzzling aspects of human nature, including pleasure, religion, and morality.'}

speaker: Josette Sheeran
about_speaker: {0: 'Our generation is the first in history with enough resources to eradicate hunger worldwide. Josette Sheeran, the former head of the UN World Food Programme, shares a plan.'}

speaker: Julian Treasure
about_speaker: {0: 'Julian Treasure studies sound and advises businesses on how best to use it.'}

speaker: Adam Ostrow
about_speaker: {0: 'As editor in chief at Mashable, Adam Ostrow covers the tech, trends and people driving the evolution of the Web.\r\n'}

speaker: Harald Haas
about_speaker: {0: 'Harald Haas is the pioneer behind a new technology that can communicate as well as illuminate.'}

speaker: Mark Pagel
about_speaker: {0: 'Using biological evolution as a template, Mark Pagel wonders how languages evolve.'}

speaker: Jessica Green
about_speaker: {0: 'Jessica Green wants people to understand the important role microbes play in every facet of our lives: climate change, building ecosystems, human health, even roller derby -- using nontraditional tools like art, animation and film to help people visualize the invisible world.'}

speaker: Eve Ensler
about_speaker: {0: 'Eve Ensler created the groundbreaking "Vagina Monologues," whose success propelled her to found V-Day -- a movement to end violence against women and girls everywhere.'}

speaker: Philip Zimbardo
about_speaker: {0: 'Philip Zimbardo was the leader of the notorious 1971 Stanford Prison Experiment -- and an expert witness at Abu Ghraib. His book The Lucifer Effect explores the nature of evil; now, in his new work, he studies the nature of heroism.'}

speaker: Alex Steffen
about_speaker: {0: "Alex Steffen explores our planet's future, telling powerful, inspiring stories about the hard choices facing humanity ... and our opportunity to create a much better tomorrow."}

speaker: Dyan deNapoli
about_speaker: {0: 'Call her "the Penguin Lady." Dyan deNapoli educates the world about these fascinating birds.'}

speaker: Jeremy Gilley
about_speaker: {0: "Filmmaker Jeremy Gilley founded Peace One Day to create an annual day without conflict. And ... it's happening. What will you do to make peace on September 21?"}

speaker: Lucianne Walkowicz
about_speaker: {0: 'Lucianne Walkowicz works on NASA\'s Kepler mission, studying starspots and "the tempestuous tantrums of stellar flares."'}

speaker: Marco Tempest
about_speaker: {0: 'Using technology and an array of special effects, Marco Tempest develops immersive environments that allow viewers to viscerally experience the magic of technology.'}

speaker: Dan Ariely
about_speaker: {0: 'The dismal science of economics is not as firmly grounded in actual behavior as was once supposed. In "Predictably Irrational," Dan Ariely told us why.'}

speaker: Svante Pääbo
about_speaker: {0: 'Svante Pääbo explores human genetic evolution by analyzing DNA extracted from ancient sources, including mummies, an Ice Age hunter and the bone fragments of Neanderthals.'}

speaker: Julia Bacha
about_speaker: {0: 'Julia Bacha is the creative director at Just Vision, an organization that uses film and multimedia storytelling to foster constructive conversations on some of the most divisive issues of our times.'}

speaker: Joan Halifax
about_speaker: {0: 'Known for her compassionate work with the terminally ill, Joan Halifax is a driving force of socially engaged Buddhism.'}

speaker: Edward Tenner
about_speaker: {0: 'Edward Tenner is an independent writer, speaker and editor who analyzes the cultural aspects of technological change.'}

speaker: Sarah Kaminsky
about_speaker: {0: 'Sarah Kaminsky writes about her father, Adolfo Kaminsky, a forger with a mission.'}

speaker: Lee Cronin
about_speaker: {0: 'A professor of chemistry, nanoscience and chemical complexity, Lee Cronin and his research group investigate how chemistry can revolutionize modern technology and even create life.'}

speaker: Raghava KK
about_speaker: {0: "Raghava KK's paintings and drawings use cartoonish shapes and colors to examine the body, society, our world. "}

speaker: Yasheng Huang
about_speaker: {0: 'Yasheng Huang asks us to rethink our ideas about China and other large emerging economies. Lately he’s been asking, Does democracy hinder or promote economic growth?'}

speaker: Misha Glenny
about_speaker: {0: 'Journalist Misha Glenny leaves no stone unturned (and no failed state unexamined) in his excavation of criminal globalization.'}

speaker: Kate Hartman
about_speaker: {0: 'Kate Hartman creates devices and interfaces for humans, houseplants, and glaciers. Her work playfully questions the ways in which we relate and communicate.'}

speaker: Richard Resnick
about_speaker: {0: 'Richard Resnick is on the front lines of the business of genomes, as CEO of GenomeQuest, a maker of genomic software.'}

speaker: Lauren Zalaznick
about_speaker: {0: 'After wholly revamping the Bravo Network, media trendsetter Lauren Zalaznick is inventing fresh ways for NBC Universal to reach coveted new audiences across multiple media.'}

speaker: Niall Ferguson
about_speaker: {0: 'History is a curious thing, and Niall Ferguson investigates not only what happened but why. (Hint: Politics and money explain a lot.)'}

speaker: Jean-Baptiste Michel
about_speaker: {0: 'Jean-Baptiste Michel looks at how we can use large volumes of data to better understand our world.', 1: 'Erez Lieberman Aiden pursues a broad range of research interests, spanning genomics, linguistics, mathematics ...'}

speaker: Amy Lockwood
about_speaker: {0: "Amy Lockwood is the deputy director of Stanford's Center for Innovation in Global Health, where she looks at new solutions to big problems."}

speaker: Elizabeth Murchison
about_speaker: {0: 'Elizabeth Murchison studies a mysterious (and contagious) cancer that threatens to wipe out Tasmanian devils.'}

speaker: Sunni Brown
about_speaker: {0: 'In her book "Gamestorming," Sunni Brown shows how using art and games can empower serious problem-solving. '}

speaker: Abraham Verghese
about_speaker: {0: 'In our era of the patient-as-data-point, Abraham Verghese believes in the old-fashioned physical exam, the bedside chat, the power of informed observation.'}

speaker: Geoff Mulgan
about_speaker: {0: 'Geoff Mulgan is director of the Young Foundation, a center for social innovation, social enterprise and public policy that pioneers ideas in fields such as aging, education and poverty reduction. He’s the founder of the think-tank Demos, and the author of "The Art of Public Strategy."'}

speaker: Jarreth Merz
about_speaker: {0: 'Jarreth Merz\' new film, "An African Election," follows the 2008 presidential elections in Ghana from start to finish.'}

speaker: Ben Goldacre
about_speaker: {0: 'Ben Goldacre unpicks dodgy scientific claims made by scaremongering journalists, dubious government reports, pharmaceutical corporations, PR companies and quacks.'}

speaker: Danielle de Niese
about_speaker: {0: 'Her voice described as a “sweet gleaming soprano,” Danielle de Niese breathes new life into opera, astonishing critics and making audiences sit up and listen.  '}

speaker: Yang Lan
about_speaker: {0: 'Yang Lan is often called “the Oprah of China.” The chair of a multiplatform business empire, Yang is pioneering more-open means of communication in the communist nation.'}

speaker: Christoph Adami
about_speaker: {0: 'Christoph Adami works on the nature of life and evolution, trying to define life in a way that is as free as possible from our preconceptions.'}

speaker: Graham Hill
about_speaker: {0: 'Graham Hill is the founder of TreeHugger.com and LifeEdited; he travels the world to tell stories of sustainability and minimalism. He tweets at @GHill.'}

speaker: Mike Biddle
about_speaker: {0: "Discarded plastic, too often, ends up buried or burned, not recycled (it's just too complicated). But Mike Biddle has found a way to close the loop."}

speaker: Charles Hazlewood
about_speaker: {0: 'Charles Hazlewood dusts off and invigorates classical music, adding a youthful energy and modern twists to centuries-old masterworks. At TEDGlobal, he conducts the Scottish Ensemble.'}

speaker: Alison Gopnik
about_speaker: {0: 'Alison Gopnik takes us into the fascinating minds of babies and children, and shows us how much we understand before we even realize we do.'}

speaker: Richard Seymour
about_speaker: {0: 'As a partner in seymourpowell, Richard Seymour designs idea-driven products -- from household goods to trains and motorcycles.'}

speaker: Pamela Meyer
about_speaker: {0: 'Pamela Meyer thinks we’re facing a pandemic of deception, but she’s arming people with tools that can help take back the truth.'}

speaker: Jae Rhim Lee
about_speaker: {0: 'Artist and TED Fellow Jae Rhim Lee re-imagines the relationships between the body and the world. '}

speaker: Bunker Roy
about_speaker: {0: 'Sanjit “Bunker” Roy is the founder of Barefoot College, which helps rural communities becomes self-sufficient.'}

speaker: Justin Hall-Tipping
about_speaker: {0: 'Justin Hall-Tipping works on nano-energy startups -- mastering the electron to create power. '}

speaker: Guy-Philippe Goldstein
about_speaker: {0: 'Guy-Philippe Goldstein is the author of Babel Minute Zero, a novel that examines the reality of cyberwar in our current geopolitical topography.'}

speaker: Todd Kuiken
about_speaker: {0: 'A doctor and  engineer, Todd Kuiken builds new prosthetics that connect with the human nervous system. Yes: bionics.'}

speaker: Nathalie Miebach
about_speaker: {0: 'Nathalie Miebach is a Boston-based artist who translates weather data into complex sculptures and musical scores.'}

speaker: Richard Wilkinson
about_speaker: {0: 'In "The Spirit Level," Richard Wilkinson charts data that proves societies that are more equal are healthier, happier societies.'}

speaker: Malcolm Gladwell
about_speaker: {0: "Detective of fads and emerging subcultures, chronicler of jobs-you-never-knew-existed, Malcolm Gladwell's work is toppling the popular understanding of bias, crime, food, marketing, race, consumers and intelligence."}

speaker: Jay Bradner
about_speaker: {0: 'In his lab, Jay Bradner, a researcher at Harvard and Dana Farber in Boston, works on a breakthrough approach for subverting cancer .. and he’s giving the secret away.'}

speaker: Béatrice Coron
about_speaker: {0: 'Béatrice Coron has developed a language of storytelling by papercutting multi-layered stories.'}

speaker: Hasan Elahi
about_speaker: {0: 'In 2002, American artist Hasan Elahi’s name was added (by mistake) to the US government’s watch list.'}

speaker: Paul Zak
about_speaker: {0: 'A pioneer in the field of neuroeconomics, Paul Zak is uncovering how the hormone oxytocin promotes trust, and proving that love is good for business.'}

speaker: Anna Mracek Dietrich
about_speaker: {0: 'Anna Mracek Dietrich is one of the creators of the Transition, the "plane you can drive."'}

speaker: Daniel Wolpert
about_speaker: {0: 'A neuroscientist and engineer, Daniel Wolpert studies how the brain controls the body.'}

speaker: Marco Tempest
about_speaker: {0: 'Using technology and an array of special effects, Marco Tempest develops immersive environments that allow viewers to viscerally experience the magic of technology.'}

speaker: Paul Lewis
about_speaker: {0: 'Reporter Paul Lewis harnesses the power of mobile phones and social media -- innovations that are making every person a potential journalist.'}

speaker: Sandra Fisher-Martins
about_speaker: {0: 'Sandra Fisher-Martins fights “information apartheid” -- the barrier created by overly complex language. '}

speaker: Martin Hanczyc
about_speaker: {0: 'Martin Hanczyc explores the path between living and nonliving systems, using chemical droplets to study behavior of the earliest cells.'}

speaker: Aparna Rao
about_speaker: {0: 'A part of the Bangalore-based artist duo Pors & Rao, TED Senior Fellow Aparna Rao works with electro-mechanical systems and interactive installations.'}

speaker: Ben Kacyra
about_speaker: {0: 'Ben Kacyra uses state-of-the-art technology to preserve cultural heritage sites and let us in on their secrets in a way never before possible.'}

speaker: Allan Jones
about_speaker: {0: 'As CEO of the Allen Institute for Brain Science, Allan Jones leads an ambitious project to build an open, online, interactive atlas of the human brain.'}

speaker: Charlie Todd
about_speaker: {0: 'Charlie Todd is the creator of Improv Everywhere, a group that creates absurd and joyful public scenes.'}

speaker: Roger McNamee
about_speaker: {0: 'Ten years from now we will interact with the internet in completely different ways. Roger McNamee identifies six changes that are already transforming the ways we consume and create content.'}

speaker: Michael Nielsen
about_speaker: {0: 'A physicist turned writer, Michael Nielsen believes online communication and collaboration tools are revolutionizing the way we make scientific discoveries.'}

speaker: Alexander Tsiaras
about_speaker: {0: 'Using art and technology, Alexander Tsiaras visualizes the unseen human body.'}

speaker: Yves Rossy
about_speaker: {0: 'With a jet-powered wing attached to his body, Yves Rossy expands the possibilities of human flight.'}

speaker: Thomas Suarez
about_speaker: {0: 'Thomas Suarez, a 12 year old, taught himself to build iphone apps.'}

speaker: Cynthia Kenyon
about_speaker: {0: 'When it comes to aging well, having “good genes” (or rather, mutant ones) is key, says Cynthia Kenyon. She unlocked the genetic secret of longevity in roundworms —\xa0and now she’s working to do the same for humans.'}

speaker: Robin Ince
about_speaker: {0: 'The rational-minded Robin Ince conducts live experiments in comedy.'}

speaker: Gabe Zichermann
about_speaker: {0: "Do kids these days have short attention spans, or does the world just move too slow? Gabe Zichermann suggests that today's video games are making children smarter -- and we should all embrace gamification."}

speaker: Natalie Warne
about_speaker: {0: 'Natalie Warne did not let being too young stop her from running a successful campaign for the Invisible Children project  In this talk, she calls on young people everywhere not to let age stop them from changing the world.'}

speaker: Phil Plait
about_speaker: {0: 'Phil Plait has spent his life evangelizing science, getting the word out about the real world and how we know what we know about it.'}

speaker: Péter Fankhauser
about_speaker: {0: 'Péter Fankhauser is the leader of a team of students working on Rezero, a robot that balances on a single sphere.'}

speaker: Joe Sabia
about_speaker: {0: 'Joe Sabia investigates new ways to tell stories -- meshing viral video and new display technologies with old-fashioned narrative.'}

speaker: Britta Riley
about_speaker: {0: 'Britta Riley designs and builds urban farms  and other participatory artworks that explore the city.'}

speaker: Amy Purdy
about_speaker: {0: 'Amy Purdy became a professional snowboarder despite losing both her legs to meningitis. She encourages us to take control of our lives, and our limits.'}

speaker: Damon Horowitz
about_speaker: {0: 'Damon Horowitz explores what is possible at the boundaries of technology and the humanities.'}

speaker: Annie Murphy Paul
about_speaker: {0: 'Annie Murphy Paul investigates how life in the womb shapes who we become.'}

speaker: John Bohannon
about_speaker: {0: 'John Bohannon is a scientist and writer who runs the annual Dance Your Ph.D. contest. ', 1: 'Black Label Movement is an explosively physical Minneapolis dance company.'}

speaker: Charles Limb
about_speaker: {0: 'Charles Limb is a doctor and a musician who researches the way musical creativity works in the brain.'}

speaker: Kathryn Schulz
about_speaker: {0: 'Kathryn Schulz is a staff writer for the New Yorker and is the author of "Being Wrong: Adventures in the Margin of Error."'}

speaker: Leslie Dodson
about_speaker: {0: 'Leslie Dodson’s work has taken her from Latin America to Indonesia covering international finance, economics, and politics.'}

speaker: Sarah Kay
about_speaker: {0: 'Sarah Kay is a poet, performer, educator and the founder of Project VOICE, an organization that uses spoken word poetry to entertain, educate and empower students and teachers worldwide.'}

speaker: Srdja Popovic
about_speaker: {0: 'Srdja Popovic was a founder and leader of the student movement that brought down the Milosovic regime. Now, he helps other nonviolent movements learn and grow.'}

speaker: Luis von Ahn
about_speaker: {0: 'Luis von Ahn builds systems that combine humans and computers to solve large-scale problems that neither can solve alone.'}

speaker: Cheryl Hayashi
about_speaker: {0: "Cheryl Hayashi studies the delicate but terrifically strong silk threads that make up a spider's web, finding startling applications for human use. "}

speaker: Yoav Medan
about_speaker: {0: 'With his team, Yoav Medan is developing a tool for incision-less surgery via focused ultrasound.'}

speaker: Stefon Harris
about_speaker: {0: 'Stefon Harris plays the vibraphone -- and leads a jazz ensemble with a collaborative sound built on collective inspiration.'}

speaker: Klaus Stadlmann
about_speaker: {0: "Klaus Stadlmann was pursuing his PhD at Vienna's Technical University when a broken laser system gave him some unexpected free time to think. Instead of working on his thesis, he decided to build the world's smallest 3D printer."}

speaker: David Damberger
about_speaker: {0: 'David Damberger’s work with Engineers Without Borders has taken him from communities in India to Southern Africa to help build infrastructure -- and learn.'}

speaker: Monika Bulaj
about_speaker: {0: 'Monika Bulaj’s stunning, painting-like photographs blur religious and cultural divisions, exploding stereotypes. She is a TED Fellow.'}

speaker: Quyen Nguyen
about_speaker: {0: 'Quyen Nguyen uses molecular probes that make tumors -- and just the tumors -- glow, as an extraordinary aid to surgeons.'}

speaker: Pavan Sukhdev
about_speaker: {0: 'A banker by training, Pavan Sukhdev runs the numbers on greening up -- showing that green economies are an effective engine for creating jobs and creating wealth.'}

speaker: Homaro Cantu
about_speaker: {0: "The executive chef at Chicago's Moto restaurant, Homaro Cantu created postmodern cuisine and futuristic food delivery systems. ", 1: 'Ben Roche is the pastry chef at Moto, in Chicago, and was the co-host, with Homaro Cantu, of the TV show "Future Food."'}

speaker: Ramona Pierson
about_speaker: {0: 'Ramona Pierson develops tools to revolutionize learning management and assessment systems -- her fourth career after aviation, neuropsychology and software development.'}

speaker: Roger Doiron
about_speaker: {0: 'Roger Doiron wants everyone to plant a garden. He’s the founder of Kitchen Gardeners International, a network of home gardeners.'}

speaker: Thomas Pogge
about_speaker: {0: 'Philosopher Thomas Pogge wants to ensure medications get to those who need it most.  He has published on a wide range of subjects such as global justice and human rights.'}

speaker: Antonio Damasio
about_speaker: {0: "Antonio Damasio's research in neuroscience has shown that emotions play a central role in social cognition and decision-making. His work has had a major influence on current understanding of the neural systems, which underlie memory, language, consciousness."}

speaker: Sheila Nirenberg
about_speaker: {0: 'Sheila Nirenberg studies how the brain encodes information -- possibly allowing us to decode it, and maybe develop prosthetic sensory devices.'}

speaker: Daniel Goldstein
about_speaker: {0: 'Daniel Goldstein studies how we make decisions about our financial selves -- both now and in the future,'}

speaker: Karen Tse
about_speaker: {0: "In too many countries, it's still normal to torture prisoners for confessions and information. Karen Tse works to end that."}

speaker: Alberto Cairo
about_speaker: {0: "Alberto Cairo leads the International Red Cross' orthopedic rehabilitation work in Afghanistan."}

speaker: A.J. Jacobs
about_speaker: {0: "Immersing himself in alternate lifestyles and hilarious experiments (usually with himself as the guinea pig), writer A.J. Jacobs tests the limits of behavior, customs, culture -- and reports back on the wisdom and practical knowledge he's gained."}

speaker: Jane Fonda
about_speaker: {0: 'Jane Fonda has had four extraordinary careers (so far): Oscar-winning actor, author, fitness guru and impassioned activist.'}

speaker: Paddy Ashdown
about_speaker: {0: 'Paddy Ashdown is a former member of the British Parliament and a diplomat with a lifelong commitment to international cooperation.'}

speaker: Sebastian Wernicke
about_speaker: {0: 'After making a splash in the field of bioinformatics, Sebastian Wernicke moved on to the corporate sphere, where he motivates and manages multidimensional projects.'}

speaker: Michelle Borkin
about_speaker: {0: 'Michelle Borkin is a PhD candidate in applied physics. She works with the Astronomical Medicine Project and interdisciplinary 3D visualization techniques.'}

speaker: Tyler Cowen
about_speaker: {0: "In his work, economist Tyler Cowen looks at clues from pop culture, art, food, to gather data and make observations on the world's globalizing culture and commerce. "}

speaker: Lauren Hodge
occupation: {0: ['science fair winner'], 1: ['science fair winner'], 2: ['science fair winner']}
about_speaker: {0: 'Lauren Hodge won the 2011 Google Science Fair in the age 13-14 category.', 1: 'Shree Bose was the grand prize winner at the 2011 Google Science Fair.', 2: 'Naomi Shah won the 2011 Google Science Fair in the age 15-16 category.'}

speaker: Jonas Gahr Støre
about_speaker: {0: "Jonas Gahr Støre is the Norwegian Foreign Minister, charged with working for Norway's interests internationally."}

speaker: Drew Berry
about_speaker: {0: 'Drew Berry creates stunning and scientifically accurate animations to illustrate how the molecules in our cell move and interact.'}

speaker: Morley
about_speaker: {0: 'Recording artist, singer, and composer Morley weaves jazz, soul and folk traditions into a vocal and acoustic splendor and has graced stages from Nomad Women’s Festival to Carnegie Hall.'}

speaker: Kirk Sorensen
about_speaker: {0: 'Kirk Sorensen stumbled across thorium while doing research on how to power a lunar community.  Thorium is a cleaner, safer, and more abundant nuclear fuel -- one that Kirk believes will revolutionize how we produce our energy.'}

speaker: British Paraorchestra
about_speaker: {0: 'The British Paraorchestra is the first orchestra for world-class musicians of disability', 1: 'Charles Hazlewood dusts off and invigorates classical music, adding a youthful energy and modern twists to centuries-old masterworks. At TEDGlobal, he conducts the Scottish Ensemble.'}

speaker: Sonaar Luthra
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Fellow Sonaar Luthra is building a weather service for water to help businesses and communities manage 21st-century water risk.'}

speaker: Alain de Botton
about_speaker: {0: 'Through his witty and literate books -- and his new School of Life  -- Alain de Botton helps others find fulfillment in the everyday. '}

speaker: Mikko Hypponen
about_speaker: {0: "As computer access expands, Mikko Hypponen asks: What's the next killer virus, and will the world be able to cope with it? And also: How can we protect digital privacy in the age of government surveillance?"}

speaker: Clay Shirky
about_speaker: {0: 'Clay Shirky argues that the history of the modern world could be rendered as the history of ways of arguing, where changes in media change what sort of arguments are possible -- with deep social and political implications.'}

speaker: Sheena Iyengar
about_speaker: {0: "Sheena Iyengar studies how people choose (and what makes us think we're good at it)."}

speaker: Scott Rickard
about_speaker: {0: 'Scott Rickard is passionate about mathematics, music -- and educating the next generation of scientists and mathematicians.'}

speaker: Bilal Bomani
about_speaker: {0: 'Bilal Bomani runs NASA’s Greenlab research facility, where he is developing the next generation of biofuels.'}

speaker: Julian Baggini
about_speaker: {0: "Julian Baggini is a journalist and philosopher who studies the complexities of personal identity. He is the editor-in-chief of the Philosophers' Magazine."}

speaker: Lisa Harouni
about_speaker: {0: 'Lisa Harouni is the co-founder of Digital Forming, working in "additive manufacturing" -- or 3D printing.'}

speaker: Diana Nyad
about_speaker: {0: 'A record-setting long-distance swimmer, Diana Nyad writes and thinks deeply about motivation.'}

speaker: Brian Goldman
about_speaker: {0: 'Brian Goldman is an emergency-room physician in Toronto, and the host of CBC Radio’s "White Coat, Black Art."'}

speaker: Gayle Tzemach Lemmon
about_speaker: {0: 'Gayle Tzemach Lemmon writes about women around the world living their lives at war and in conflict zones.'}

speaker: Mick Mountz
about_speaker: {0: 'Mick Mountz is the founder and CEO of Kiva Systems, making high-tech products for fast, cheap and efficient inventory fulfillment. In March 2012, Kiva was acquired by Amazon.'}

speaker: Peter van Uhm
about_speaker: {0: 'General Peter van Uhm is the Chief of the Netherlands Defence staff.'}

speaker: Bill Doyle
about_speaker: {0: 'With his company Novocure, Bill Doyle works to bring breakthrough medical technologies to doctors and patients. '}

speaker: Shawn Achor
about_speaker: {0: 'Shawn Achor is the CEO of Good Think Inc., where he researches and teaches about positive psychology.'}

speaker: Erica Frenkel
about_speaker: {0: 'At Gradian Health Systems, Erica Frenkel works to bring safe anesthesia to hospitals all over the world.'}

speaker: Danny Hillis
about_speaker: {0: 'Inventor, scientist, author, engineer -- over his broad career, Danny Hillis has turned his ever-searching brain on an array of subjects, with surprising results.'}

speaker: Mike deGruy
about_speaker: {0: 'Mike deGruy filmed in and on the ocean for more than three decades -- becoming almost as famous for his storytelling as for his glorious, intimate visions of the sea and the creatures who live in it.'}

speaker: Aleph Molinari
about_speaker: {0: 'Through education and technology-focused community centers, Aleph Molinari empowers the 5 billion people who cannot access or use the Internet and other technologies.'}

speaker: Nancy Duarte
about_speaker: {0: 'Nancy Duarte believes that ideas are the most powerful tools people have.  Her passion is to help every person learn to communicate their world-changing idea effectively.'}

speaker: Neil Burgess
about_speaker: {0: 'At University College in London, Neil Burgess researches how patterns of electrical activity in brain cells guide us through space.'}

speaker: Stephen Coleman
about_speaker: {0: 'Stephen Coleman studies applied ethics, particularly the ethics of military and police force, and their application to human rights.'}

speaker: Sheikha Al Mayassa
about_speaker: {0: "Sheikha Al Mayassa is the young and progressive force behind Qatar's mission to become the Middle East's foremost destination for the arts and culture. "}

speaker: Jack Horner
about_speaker: {0: "Jack Horner and his dig teams have discovered the first evidence of parental care in dinosaurs, extensive nesting grounds, evidence of dinosaur herds, and the world’s first dinosaur embryos. He's now exploring how to build a dinosaur."}

speaker: Erik Johansson
about_speaker: {0: 'Photographer Erik Johansson creates impossible but photorealistic images that capture an idea, not a moment.'}

speaker: Drew Dudley
about_speaker: {0: 'Drew Dudley believes leadership is not a characteristic reserved for the extraordinary. He works to help people discover the leader within themselves.'}

speaker: Keith Nolan
about_speaker: {0: "Keith Nolan doesn't believe his deafness should be a barrier to serving his country -- and is making the case for increasing the role of citizens with disabilities in the military. "}

speaker: Tyrone Hayes
about_speaker: {0: 'Tyrone Hayes studies frogs and amphibians -- and the effects on their bodies of common farming chemicals.', 1: 'Penelope Jagessar Chaffer made the film "Toxic Baby," exploring environmental toxins through interviews and surreal imagery.'}

speaker: Jenna McCarthy
about_speaker: {0: 'Jenna McCarthy writes about relationships, marriage and parenting.'}

speaker: Lucien Engelen
about_speaker: {0: 'Lucien Engelen is a strategist and innovator in health(care) who is working to put patients into the healthcare team.'}

speaker: Simon Berrow
about_speaker: {0: 'Simon Berrow is a marine biologist dedicated to studying and preserving the basking shark.'}

speaker: Paul Conneally
about_speaker: {0: 'Paul Conneally is the public communications manager for the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and a leader in using digital technologies for humanitarian aid.'}

speaker: Garth Lenz
about_speaker: {0: 'Garth Lenz’ touring exhibition, “The True Cost of Oil”, has played a major part in the fight against Alberta Tar Sands Mining.'}

speaker: Lucianne Walkowicz
about_speaker: {0: 'Lucianne Walkowicz works on NASA\'s Kepler mission, studying starspots and "the tempestuous tantrums of stellar flares."'}

speaker: Neil MacGregor
about_speaker: {0: 'The writer and presenter of the BBC Radio 4 series "A History of the World in 100 Objects" and the accompanying book. '}

speaker: Chris Bliss
about_speaker: {0: 'Chris Bliss explores the inherent challenge of communication, and how comedy opens paths to new perspectives. '}

speaker: Shilo Shiv Suleman
about_speaker: {0: 'Shilo Shiv Suleman is an illustrator, storyteller and iPad book creator.'}

speaker: Shlomo Benartzi
about_speaker: {0: 'Shlomo Benartzi uses behavioral economics to study how and why we plan well for the future (or fail to), and uses that to develop new programs to encourage saving for retirement.'}

speaker: Tan Le
about_speaker: {0: "Tan Le is the founder & CEO of Emotiv, a bioinformatics company that's working on identifying biomarkers for mental and other neurological conditions using electroencephalography (EEG)."}

speaker: Avi Rubin
about_speaker: {0: 'Avi Rubin is a professor of computer science and director of the Health and Medical Security Lab at Johns Hopkins University. His research is focused on the security of electronic records -- including medical and voting records.'}

speaker: Jeffrey Kluger
about_speaker: {0: 'A senior editor of science and technology reporting at TIME magazine, Jeffrey Kluger has written books on a wide range of science subjects, including the Polio vaccine, Apollo 13 and the effect of sibling relationships.'}

speaker: Kevin Allocca
about_speaker: {0: "Kevin Allocca is YouTube's expert on the intersection of web video and global culture"}

speaker: Daniel Pauly
