about_speaker: {0: "Daniel Pauly is the principal investigator at the Sea Around Us Project, which studies the impact of the world's fisheries on marine ecosystems. The software he's helped develop is used around the world to model and track the ocean."}

speaker: Paul Snelgrove
about_speaker: {0: 'Paul Snelgrove led the group that pulled together the findings of the Census of Marine Life -- synthesizing 10 years and 540 expeditions into a book of wonders.'}

speaker: Peter Diamandis
about_speaker: {0: 'Peter Diamandis runs the X Prize Foundation, which offers large cash incentive prizes to inventors who can solve grand challenges like space flight, low-cost mobile medical diagnostics and oil spill cleanup. He is the chair of Singularity University, which teaches executives and grad students about exponentially growing technologies.'}

speaker: Paul Gilding
about_speaker: {0: 'Paul Gilding is an independent writer, activist and adviser on a sustainable economy. Click through to watch the onstage debate that followed this talk.'}

speaker: Vijay Kumar
about_speaker: {0: "As the dean of the University of Pennsylvania's School of Engineering and Applied Science, Vijay Kumar studies the control and coordination of multi-robot formations."}

speaker: Susan Cain
about_speaker: {0: "Our world prizes extroverts, but Susan Cain makes a case for the contemplative. She's leading a social revolution that's showing people that looking inward is a virtue, not a problem."}

speaker: Bryan Stevenson
about_speaker: {0: 'Bryan Stevenson is the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative, fighting poverty and challenging racial discrimination in the criminal justice system.'}

speaker: Andrew Stanton
about_speaker: {0: 'Andrew Stanton has made you laugh and cry. The writer behind the three "Toy Story" movies and the writer/director of "WALL-E," he releases his new film, "John Carter," in March.'}

speaker: James Hansen
about_speaker: {0: 'James Hansen has made key insights into our global climate -- and inspired a generation of activists and scientists.'}

speaker: Jennifer Pahlka
about_speaker: {0: 'Jennifer Pahlka is the founder of Code for America, which matches software geniuses with US cities to reboot local services.'}

speaker: Colin Robertson
about_speaker: {0: 'Colin Robertson is apparently "attempting to make the world\'s first crowdsourced solar energy solution" Or is he?'}

speaker: Kelli Anderson
about_speaker: {0: 'From wedding invitations to Utopian newspapers, Kelli Anderson re-designs commonplace objects to go beyond their ordinary functions and create surprising experiences.'}

speaker: Larry Smith
about_speaker: {0: 'A professor of economics at the University of Waterloo in Canada, Larry Smith coaches his students to find the careers that they will truly love.'}

speaker: Greg Gage
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Fellow Greg Gage helps kids investigate the neuroscience in their own backyards.'}

speaker: Chris Anderson
about_speaker: {0: 'After a long career in journalism and publishing, Chris Anderson became the curator of the TED Conference in 2002 and has developed it as a platform for identifying and disseminating ideas worth spreading.'}

speaker: David Gallo
about_speaker: {0: 'A pioneer in ocean exploration, David Gallo is an enthusiastic ambassador between the sea and those of us on dry land.'}

speaker: Adam Savage
about_speaker: {0: 'Adam Savage is an internationally renowned television producer, host and public speaker.'}

speaker: Jonathan Haidt
about_speaker: {0: 'Jonathan Haidt studies how -- and why -- we evolved to be moral and political creatures.'}

speaker: Rob Reid
about_speaker: {0: 'Author and entrepreneur Rob Reid writes speculative fiction for Random House.'}

speaker: Brené Brown
about_speaker: {0: 'Brené Brown studies vulnerability, courage, authenticity and shame.'}

speaker: Scott Summit
about_speaker: {0: 'Scott Summit uses his 20 years of experience as an industrial designer to make artificial limbs that help people take personal control of these intimate objects.'}

speaker: Mark Raymond
about_speaker: {0: 'Mark Raymond’s work as an architect in Trinidad and Tobago is founded on the belief that thoughtfully designed cities can foster sustainability and inclusiveness throughout a society.'}

speaker: T. Boone Pickens
about_speaker: {0: 'A legendary oil and gas entrepreneur, T. Boone Pickens is now on a mission to enhance U.S. energy policies to lessen the nation’s dependence on OPEC oil.'}

speaker: C. Noel Bairey Merz
about_speaker: {0: "C. Noel Bairey Merz is director of the Women's Heart Center at the Cedars-Sinai Heart Institute, where she is a professor of medicine."}

speaker: Taylor Wilson
about_speaker: {0: 'At 14, Taylor Wilson became the youngest person to achieve fusion -- with a reactor born in his garage. Now he wants to save our seaports from nuclear terror.'}

speaker: Billy Collins
about_speaker: {0: 'A two-term U.S. Poet Laureate, Billy Collins captures readers with his understated wit, profound insight -- and a sense of being "hospitable."'}

speaker: Jer Thorp
about_speaker: {0: 'Jer Thorp’s work focuses on adding meaning and narrative to huge amounts of data as a way to help people take control of the information that surrounds them.'}

speaker: Peter Saul
about_speaker: {0: 'Over the past 35 years Peter Saul has been intimately involved in the dying process for over 4,000 patients. He is passionate about improving the ways we die.'}

speaker: Donald Sadoway
about_speaker: {0: 'Donald Sadoway is working on a battery miracle -- an inexpensive, incredibly efficient, three-layered battery using “liquid metal."'}

speaker: Regina Dugan
about_speaker: {0: "As director of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), Regina Dugan oversaw the US armed forces' innovation engine. Now she deploys the same research tactics at Google."}

speaker: Leymah Gbowee
about_speaker: {0: "Leymah Gbowee is a peace activist in Liberia. She led a women's movement that was pivotal in ending the Second Liberian Civil War in 2003, and now speaks on behalf of women and girls around the world."}

speaker: Ayah Bdeir
about_speaker: {0: 'Ayah Bdeir is an engineer and artist, and is the founder of littleBits and karaj, an experimental art, architecture and technology lab in Beirut.'}

speaker: Marco Tempest
about_speaker: {0: 'Using technology and an array of special effects, Marco Tempest develops immersive environments that allow viewers to viscerally experience the magic of technology.'}

speaker: Daniel Schnitzer
about_speaker: {0: 'Daniel Schnitzer is the founder of EarthSpark International, a company dedicated to helping create clean energy supply chains in Haiti.\r\n'}

speaker: Rick Falkvinge
about_speaker: {0: 'Rick Falkvinge, didn’t plan on becoming a politician, but his dedication to civil liberties and internet sovereignty led to him founding the Swedish Pirate Party in 2006.'}

speaker: Tierney Thys
about_speaker: {0: 'Tierney Thys is a marine biologist and science educator. She studies the behavior of the Mola mola, or giant ocean sunfish -- and works with other scientists to make films that share the wonders they see.', 1: 'The Plankton Chronicles Project uses state-of-the-art optics to reveal the beauty and diversity of planktonic organisms. It was initiated by Christian Sardet, Noé Sardet and Sharif Mirshak.'}

speaker: Sherry Turkle
about_speaker: {0: 'Sherry Turkle studies how technology is shaping our modern relationships: with others, with ourselves, with it.'}

speaker: Chip Kidd
about_speaker: {0: "Chip Kidd's book jacket designs spawned a revolution in the art of American book packaging."}

speaker: Jack Choi
about_speaker: {0: 'Jack is the CEO of Anatomage, a company specializing on 3D medical technology.'}

speaker: Lucy McRae
about_speaker: {0: 'Trained as a classical ballerina and architect, Lucy McRae is fascinated by the human body, and how it can be shaped by technology. '}

speaker: Carvens Lissaint
about_speaker: {0: 'Carvens Lissaint is a Haitian American poet, actor, singer and playwright, currently starring in the Tony-winning musical HAMILTON as George Washington on Broadway.'}

speaker: Jonathan Foley
about_speaker: {0: 'Jonathan Foley studies complex environmental systems and their affects on society. His computer models have shown the deep impact agriculture is having on our planet.'}

speaker: Frank Warren
about_speaker: {0: 'Frank Warren is the creator of the PostSecret Project, a blog full of secrets anonymously shared via postcard.'}

speaker: Frans de Waal
about_speaker: {0: 'Frans de Waal studies primate social behavior -- how they fight and reconcile, share and cooperate.'}

speaker: Melinda Gates
about_speaker: {0: 'Melinda French Gates is co-chair of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, where she puts into practice the idea that every life has equal value.'}

speaker: Tal Golesworthy
about_speaker: {0: 'Tal Golesworthy is an engineer and entrepreneur, working in research and development of combustion and air pollution control -- until he decided to innovate in his own health.'}

speaker: Abigail Washburn
about_speaker: {0: "Abigail Washburn pairs venerable folk elements with far-flung sounds, creating results that feel both strangely familiar and unlike anything anybody's ever heard before."}

speaker: Atul Gawande
about_speaker: {0: 'Surgeon and public health professor by day, writer by night, Atul Gawande explores how doctors can dramatically improve their practice using approaches as simple as a checklist – or coaching.'}

speaker: Drew Curtis
about_speaker: {0: 'Drew Curtis is the founder and administrator of Fark.com.'}

speaker: Taryn Simon
about_speaker: {0: 'With a large-format camera and a knack for talking her way into forbidden zones, Taryn Simon photographs portions of the American infrastructure inaccessible to its inhabitants.'}

speaker: Laura Carstensen
about_speaker: {0: 'Laura Carstensen is the director of the Stanford Center on Longevity, and has extensively studied the effects on wellbeing of extended lifetimes.'}

speaker: Christina Warinner
about_speaker: {0: 'Christina Warinner is a researcher at the University of Zurich, where she studies how humans have co-evolved with environments, diets and disease.'}

speaker: Brian Greene
about_speaker: {0: 'Brian Greene is perhaps the best-known proponent of superstring theory, the idea that minuscule strands of energy vibrating in a higher dimensional space-time create every particle and force in the universe.'}

speaker: Michael Norton
about_speaker: {0: 'Through clever studies, Michael Norton studies how we feel about what we buy and spend.'}

speaker: Jon Bergmann
about_speaker: {0: 'Jon Bergmann co-wrote the book on the "flipped classroom" -- using video to help students master new ideas outside the traditional class setting.'}

speaker: Eduardo Paes
about_speaker: {0: "Mayor Eduardo Paes is on a mission to ensure that Rio's renaissance creates a positive legacy for all its citizens."}

speaker: Nancy Lublin
about_speaker: {0: 'Nancy Lublin, cofounder and CEO of Crisis Text Line, is using technology and data to save lives.'}

speaker: Joe Smith
about_speaker: {0: 'Joe Smith is an active figure in the Oregon community and a powerful advocate for proper paper towel use.'}

speaker: Brenda Romero
about_speaker: {0: "Brenda Romero designs games that turn some of history's most tragic lessons into interactive, emotional experiences."}

speaker: Liz Diller
about_speaker: {0: 'Liz Diller and her maverick firm DS+R bring a groundbreaking approach to big and small projects in architecture, urban design and art -- playing with new materials, tampering with space and spectacle in ways that make you look twice.'}

speaker: Amory Lovins
about_speaker: {0: 'In his new book, "Reinventing Fire," Amory Lovins shares ingenious ideas for the next era of energy.'}

speaker: Reuben Margolin
about_speaker: {0: "Reuben Margolin's moving sculptures combine the logic of math with the sensuousness of nature."}

speaker: Gary Kovacs
about_speaker: {0: 'Gary Kovacs is a technologist and the former CEO of the Mozilla Corporation, where he directed the development of Firefox.'}

speaker: Rory Sutherland
about_speaker: {0: 'Rory Sutherland stands at the center of an advertising revolution in brand identities, designing cutting-edge, interactive campaigns that blur the line between ad and entertainment.'}

speaker: Tavi Gevinson
about_speaker: {0: 'Tavi Gevinson is a fashion blogger and a feminist who encourages everyone to embrace their complexity and look cool doing it.'}

speaker: Rick Guidotti
about_speaker: {0: 'Photographer Rick Guidotti sees a rich beauty in our genetic diversity and works to expose that vision to everyone.'}

speaker: Michael Tilson Thomas
about_speaker: {0: 'Conductor Michael Tilson Thomas (call him MTT) is an all-around music educator -- connecting with global audiences, young musicians and concertgoers in San Francisco and London.'}

speaker: JP Rangaswami
about_speaker: {0: 'JP Rangaswami thinks deeply (and hilariously) about disruptive data.'}

speaker: Karen Bass
about_speaker: {0: 'Karen Bass has traveled the world to explore and capture footage from every environment across the Earth.'}

speaker: Joshua Foer
about_speaker: {0: "Joshua Foer is a science writer who 'accidentally' won the U.S. Memory Championship."}

speaker: Renny Gleeson
about_speaker: {0: 'Renny Gleeson helps navigate brands through fresh concepts, such as viral marketing and social media, to find the pulse of the modern consumer.  '}

speaker: José Bowen
about_speaker: {0: 'José Bowen is an accomplished musician and teacher who explores how technology has shaped the history of music.'}

speaker: Bart Knols
about_speaker: {0: 'Bart Knols is a doctor committed to killing mosquitoes and ending malaria.'}

speaker: Tali Sharot
about_speaker: {0: 'Tali Sharot studies why our brains are biased toward optimism.'}

speaker: Jean-Baptiste Michel
about_speaker: {0: 'Jean-Baptiste Michel looks at how we can use large volumes of data to better understand our world.'}

speaker: David Kelley
about_speaker: {0: 'David Kelley’s company IDEO helped create many icons of the digital generation -- but what matters even more to him is unlocking the creative potential of people and organizations to innovate routinely.'}

speaker: Carl Schoonover
about_speaker: {0: 'Carl Schoonover is a neuroscientist and one of the founders of NeuWrite, a collaboration between writers and neuroscientist.'}

speaker: JR
about_speaker: {0: 'With a camera, a dedicated wheatpasting crew and the help of whole villages and favelas, 2011 TED Prize winner JR shows the world its true face.'}

speaker: Michael McDaniel
about_speaker: {0: 'Michael McDaniel is a graphic designer using his skills to help people in meaningful ways. '}

speaker: Melissa Garren
about_speaker: {0: "Melissa Garren is a molecular and marine biologist with a passion for unlocking the mysteries of our ocean's ecosystems and finding new avenues for conservation."}

speaker: Nathan Wolfe
about_speaker: {0: "Armed with blood samples, high-tech tools and a small army of fieldworkers, Nathan Wolfe hopes to re-invent pandemic control -- and reveal hidden secrets of the planet's dominant lifeform: the virus."}

speaker: Hans Rosling
about_speaker: {0: 'In Hans Rosling’s hands, data sings. Global trends in health and economics come to vivid life. And the big picture of global development -- with some surprisingly good news -- snaps into sharp focus.'}

speaker: Philippe Petit
about_speaker: {0: 'High-wire artist Philippe Petit surprised the world when he walked illegally between the Twin Towers in 1974.'}

speaker: Shereen El Feki
about_speaker: {0: 'Shereen El Feki works and writes on sexuality and social change in the Arab world.'}

speaker: Reggie Watts
about_speaker: {0: 'Reggie Watts creates unpredictably brilliant performances on the spot using his voice, looping pedals and his giant brain.'}

speaker: David MacKay
about_speaker: {0: 'As an information theorist and computer scientist,\xa0David MacKay uses hard math to assess our renewable energy options.'}

speaker: Ken Goldberg
about_speaker: {0: 'Ken Goldberg works reflect the intersection of robotics, social media, and art.'}

speaker: William Noel
about_speaker: {0: 'William Noel is a curator who believes museums should make their collections free and available on the Internet.'}

speaker: Dalia Mogahed
about_speaker: {0: 'Researcher and pollster Dalia Mogahed is an author, advisor and consultant who studies Muslim communities.'}

speaker: Sebastian Deterding
about_speaker: {0: 'Sebastian Deterding is an interface designer who thinks deeply about persuasive and gameful design.'}

speaker: Quixotic Fusion
about_speaker: {0: 'Anthony Magliano\xa0and\xa0Mica Thomas\xa0are the founder and artistic directors of Quixotic, a mixed-media theater/performance/aerialist company.'}

speaker: Seth Shostak
about_speaker: {0: 'Seth Shostak is an astronomer, alien hunter and bulwark of good, exciting science.'}

speaker: David Birch
about_speaker: {0: 'David Birch is a digital money and ID consultant paving the way for a 21st-century identity.'}

speaker: Juan Enriquez
about_speaker: {0: 'Juan Enriquez thinks and writes about the profound changes that genomics and brain research will bring about in business, technology, politics and society.'}

speaker: Diane Kelly
about_speaker: {0: 'Diane Kelly studies vertebrate anatomy, in particular the connection between the design and the function of reproductive organs.'}

speaker: Terry Moore
about_speaker: {0: 'Terry Moore is the director of the Radius Foundation, a forum for exploring and gaining insight from different worldviews.'}

speaker: Damian Palin
about_speaker: {0: 'Damian Palin is developing a way to use bacteria to biologically "mine" minerals from water -- specifically, out of the brine left over from the desalinization process.'}

speaker: John Hodgman
about_speaker: {0: 'John Hodgman is a writer, humorist, geek celebrity, former professional literary agent and expert on all world knowledge. He was the bumbling PC in Apple\'s long-running "I\'m a Mac; I\'m a PC" ad campaign.'}

speaker: Ami Klin
about_speaker: {0: 'Ami Klin is an award winning autism spectrum disorder researcher finding new avenues for early diagnosis.'}

speaker: John Hockenberry
about_speaker: {0: 'Journalist and commentator John Hockenberry has reported from all over the world in virtually every medium. He\'s the author of "Moving Violations: War Zones, Wheelchairs and Declarations of Independence."'}

speaker: Rebecca Onie
about_speaker: {0: 'Rebecca Onie is a nationally recognized leader in the intersection of social determinants, population health and health care delivery'}

speaker: Baroness Beeban Kidron
about_speaker: {0: 'Beeban Kidron directed Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason and Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit. She also cofounded FILMCLUB, a charity for students devoted to the art of storytelling through film.'}

speaker: Sarah Parcak
about_speaker: {0: 'Like a modern-day Indiana Jones, Sarah Parcak uses satellite images to locate lost ancient sites. The winner of the 2016 TED Prize, her wish is to protect the world’s shared cultural heritage.'}

speaker: LZ Granderson
about_speaker: {0: 'CNN and ESPN columnist LZ Granderson is a celebrated voice on sports, race and gay rights.'}

speaker: Rodney Mullen
about_speaker: {0: 'Rodney Mullen is a legendary skateboarder who transformed the art of street skating.'}

speaker: Megan Kamerick
about_speaker: {0: 'Journalist Megan Kamerick fights for well-balanced storytelling in media.\r\n'}

speaker: David R. Dow
about_speaker: {0: 'David R. Dow has defended over 100 death row inmates in 20 years.'}

speaker: Ivan Oransky
about_speaker: {0: 'Ivan Oransky is the executive editor of Reuters Health, and has done pioneering work in covering scientific retractions.'}

speaker: Marco Tempest
about_speaker: {0: 'Using technology and an array of special effects, Marco Tempest develops immersive environments that allow viewers to viscerally experience the magic of technology.'}

speaker: Peter Norvig
about_speaker: {0: 'Peter Norvig is a leading American computer scientist, expert on artificial intelligence and the Director of Research at Google Inc.'}

speaker: Wolfgang Kessling
about_speaker: {0: 'Wolfgang Kessling and his team at Transsolar designed the solar cooling and comfort concepts that helped Qatar win the bid for the 2022 football World Cup.'}

speaker: Jon Nguyen
about_speaker: {0: 'Jon Nguyen is an award winning aeronautics and graphics engineer at NASA.'}

speaker: Nirmalya Kumar
about_speaker: {0: 'Nirmalya Kumar is a professor of Marketing at the London Business School and a passionate voice for new entrepreneurs in India.'}

speaker: E.O. Wilson
about_speaker: {0: 'Biologist E.O. Wilson explores the world of ants and other tiny creatures, and writes movingly about the way all creatures great and small are interdependent.'}

speaker: Rives
about_speaker: {0: 'Performance artist and storyteller Rives has been called "the first 2.0 poet," using images, video and technology to bring his words to life. '}

speaker: Massimo Banzi
about_speaker: {0: 'Massimo Banzi co-founded Arduino, which makes affordable open-source microcontrollers for interactive projects, from art installations to an automatic plant waterer.'}

speaker: Don Tapscott
about_speaker: {0: 'Don Tapscott, Executive Chairman of the Blockchain Research Institute, is one of the world’s leading authorities on the impact of technology in business and society. He has authored 16 books, including "Wikinomics: How Mass Collaboration Changes Everything," which has been translated into over 25 languages'}

speaker: Elyn Saks
about_speaker: {0: 'Elyn Saks asks bold questions about how society treats people with mental illness.'}

speaker: Boaz Almog
about_speaker: {0: 'Boaz Almog uses quantum physics to levitate and trap objects in midair. Call it "quantum levitation."'}

speaker: Alanna Shaikh
about_speaker: {0: 'Alanna Shaikh is a global health consultant who specializes in strengthening health systems. '}

speaker: Raghava KK
about_speaker: {0: "Raghava KK's paintings and drawings use cartoonish shapes and colors to examine the body, society, our world. "}

speaker: Cesar Harada
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Senior Fellow Cesar Harada aims to harness the forces of nature as he invents innovative remedies for man-made problems like oil spills and radioactive leaks.'}

speaker: Preston Reed
about_speaker: {0: 'Preston Reed’s hands have an otherworldly coordination. The fingers, nails, thumbs, and palms of both left and right dance, pluck, strum, and slap his guitar, which bursts with a full sound.', 1: 'TED Senior Fellow Usman Riaz is an artist and composer.'}

speaker: Jane McGonigal
about_speaker: {0: 'Reality is broken, says Jane McGonigal, and we need to make it work more like a game. Her work shows us how.'}

speaker: Jonathan Eisen
about_speaker: {0: 'Jonathan Eisen studies the ecology and evolution of microbial communities -- and their co-evolution with their hosts.'}

speaker: Chris Gerdes
about_speaker: {0: 'An autonomous car may seem like a thing of the distant future, but mechanical engineer Chris Gerdes is racing to make it a reality today.'}

speaker: Marc Goodman
about_speaker: {0: 'Marc Goodman works to prevent future crimes and acts of terrorism, even those security threats not yet invented.'}

speaker: Jared Ficklin
about_speaker: {0: 'In his day job, Jared Ficklin makes user interfaces at frog design. As a hobby, he explores what music looks like ... in light, in shapes, in fire.'}

speaker: Todd Humphreys
about_speaker: {0: 'Todd Humphreys studies GPS, its future, and how we can address some of its biggest security problems.'}

speaker: Gabriel Barcia-Colombo
about_speaker: {0: 'Gabe Barcia-Colombo creates madcap art inspired both by Renaissance era curiosity cabinets and the modern-day digital chronicling of everyday life. Think: miniature people projected in objects and a DNA Vending Machine.'}

speaker: Mina Bissell
about_speaker: {0: "Mina Bissell studies how cancer interacts with our bodies, searching for clues to how cancer's microenvironment influences its growth."}

speaker: Jamie Drummond
about_speaker: {0: 'Jamie Drummond co-founded the advocacy organization ONE, whose central themes are ending extreme poverty and fighting the AIDS pandemic.'}

speaker: Baba Shiv
about_speaker: {0: 'Baba Shiv studies how “liking” and “wanting” shape the choices we make, and what that means in the world of marketing.'}

speaker: Matt Mills
about_speaker: {0: 'Matt Mills comes from Aurasma, a startup that makes augmented-reality technology for mobile phones.', 1: 'Tamara Roukaerts is head of marketing at Aurasma, working to build an augmented-reality lens via smartphones.'}

speaker: Neil Harbisson
about_speaker: {0: 'Neil Harbisson\'s "eyeborg" allows him to hear colors, even those beyond the range of sight.'}

speaker: John Graham-Cumming
about_speaker: {0: 'Computer programmer John Graham-Cumming keeps geek history alive by raising awareness for its heroes and their inventions.'}

speaker: Vinay Venkatraman
about_speaker: {0: 'Vinay Venkatraman aims to design technological devices for the "bottom of the pyramid" rather than simply for the affluent.'}

speaker: James Stavridis
about_speaker: {0: 'What will 21st-century security look like? Navy Admiral James Stavridis suggests that dialogue and openness will be the game-changers.'}

speaker: Malte Spitz
about_speaker: {0: 'Malte Spitz asked his cell phone carrier what it knew about him -- and mapped what he found out.'}

speaker: Tracy Chevalier
about_speaker: {0: 'Novelist Tracy Chevalier is the author of "Girl With a Pearl Earring."'}

speaker: Ramesh Raskar
about_speaker: {0: 'Photography is about creating images by recording light. At the MIT media lab, professor Ramesh Raskar and his team members have invented a camera that can photograph light itself as it moves at, well, the speed of light.'}

speaker: Michael Hansmeyer
about_speaker: {0: 'Michael Hansmeyer is an architect and programmer who explores the use of algorithms and computation to generate architectural form.'}

speaker: Noah Wilson-Rich
about_speaker: {0: "Noah Wilson-Rich doesn't just want to know why bees are dying off, but what's saving them."}

speaker: Giles Duley
about_speaker: {0: 'Giles Duley began his career as a fashion photographer. When it was time for a change he found himself on a journey of war and hardship.'}

speaker: Michael Anti
about_speaker: {0: "Michael Anti (Zhao Jing), a key figure in China's new journalism, explores the growing power of the Chinese internet."}

speaker: Stephen Ritz
about_speaker: {0: 'Stephen Ritz teaches at-risk kids in the South Bronx.'}

speaker: Daphne Koller
about_speaker: {0: 'With Coursera, Daphne Koller and co-founder Andrew Ng are bringing courses from top colleges online, free, for anyone who wants to take them.'}

speaker: Becci Manson
about_speaker: {0: 'After the March 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan, Becci Manson and her volunteer colleagues cleaned and restored hundreds of damaged photos.'}

speaker: Mark Applebaum
about_speaker: {0: 'Mark Applebaum has built an instrument out of doorstops and combs, as well as composed a piece of music to be performed by a florist.'}

speaker: Hannah Fry
about_speaker: {0: 'Hannah Fry researches the trends in our civilization and ways we can forecast its future.'}

speaker: Scilla Elworthy
about_speaker: {0: 'Scilla Elworthy founded Oxford Research Group in 1982, to promote effective dialogue between nuclear weapons policy-makers and their opponents.'}

speaker: Margaret Heffernan
about_speaker: {0: 'The former CEO of five businesses, Margaret Heffernan explores the all-too-human thought patterns that lead organizations and managers astray.'}

speaker: Max Little
about_speaker: {0: "Max Little is a mathematician whose research includes a breakthrough technique to monitor – and potentially screen for – Parkinson's disease through simple voice recordings."}

speaker: Pam Warhurst
about_speaker: {0: 'Pam Warhurst cofounded Incredible Edible, an initiative in Todmorden, England dedicated to growing food locally by planting on unused land throughout the community.'}

speaker: Kirby Ferguson
about_speaker: {0: 'Kirby Ferguson explores creativity in a world where "everything is a remix."'}

speaker: Lisa Kristine
about_speaker: {0: 'Lisa Kristine uses photography to expose deeply human stories.'}

speaker: Mark Forsyth
about_speaker: {0: 'Mark Forsyth strolls through the English language, telling stories, making connections and banishing hobgoblins.'}

speaker: Ivan Krastev
about_speaker: {0: 'From his home base in Bulgaria, Ivan Krastev thinks about democracy -- and how to reframe it.'}

speaker: Caitria O'Neill
about_speaker: {0: "When a freak tornado hit her Massachusetts hometown, Caitria O’Neill wasn't an expert in disaster relief recovery. But she learned quickly and is now passing her knowledge on through the website Recovers.org.", 1: "Pursuing her PhD in atmospheric science did not prepare Morgan O'Neill for a freak tornado hitting her hometown. With her sister, she helped coordinate a local relief effort and is teaching other towns to do the same through the website Recovers.org."}

speaker: Jon Ronson
about_speaker: {0: 'Jon Ronson is a writer and documentary filmmaker who dips into every flavor of madness, extremism and obsession.'}

speaker: Timothy Prestero
about_speaker: {0: 'Timothy Prestero loves a flashy "concept car." But in his own work, he aims to design products for social impact, keeping users in mind.'}

speaker: Rob Legato
about_speaker: {0: 'Rob Legato creates surprising and creative visual illusions for movies.'}

speaker: Robert Neuwirth
about_speaker: {0: 'Robert Neuwirth’s writings on the street-level reality of the developing world have opened a new dialogue on development and economics.'}

speaker: Shyam Sankar
about_speaker: {0: 'An advocate of human-computer symbiosis, Shyam Sankar looks for clues in big and disparate data sets.'}

speaker: Antony Gormley
about_speaker: {0: "Antony Gormley's work plays with the human form in space."}

speaker: Jonathan Trent
about_speaker: {0: 'Not only does Jonathan Trent grow algae for biofuel, he wants to do so by cleansing wastewater and trapping carbon dioxide in the process. And it’s all solar-powered.'}

speaker: Kent Larson
about_speaker: {0: 'Kent Larson designs new technologies that solve the biggest questions facing our cities.'}

speaker: Scott Fraser
about_speaker: {0: 'Scott Fraser is a forensic psychologist who thinks deeply about the fallibility of human memory and encourages a more scientific approach to trial evidence.'}

speaker: Vikram Patel
about_speaker: {0: 'Vikram Patel helps bring better mental health care to low-resource communities -- by teaching ordinary people to deliver basic psychiatric services.'}

speaker: Leslie T. Chang
about_speaker: {0: 'In her reporting and writing, Leslie T. Chang explores the lives of workers in China, focusing on the experience of women.'}

speaker: Susan Solomon
about_speaker: {0: 'Susan Solomon enables support for human stem cell research, aiming to cure major diseases and empower more personalized medicine.'}

speaker: Wayne McGregor
about_speaker: {0: 'Wayne McGregor and his dancers explore the uncharted territory where mind and movement intersect.'}

speaker: Beth Noveck
about_speaker: {0: 'A lawyer by training and a techie by inclination, Beth Noveck works to build data transparency into government.'}

speaker: Tristram Stuart
about_speaker: {0: 'Tristram Stuart sounds the warning bell on global food waste, calling for us to change the systems whereby large quantities of produce and other foods end up in trash heaps.'}

speaker: Sarah-Jayne Blakemore
about_speaker: {0: 'Sarah-Jayne Blakemore is Professor of Psychology at the University of Cambridge, UK, and leader of the Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience Group. '}

speaker: Julian Treasure
about_speaker: {0: 'Julian Treasure studies sound and advises businesses on how best to use it.'}

speaker: Andrew Blum
about_speaker: {0: 'For his new book, "Tubes," Andrew Blum visited the places where the internet exists in physical form: the cables and switches and servers that virtually connect us.'}

speaker: Bandi Mbubi
about_speaker: {0: 'Bandi Mbubi would like to make sure that you are using a fair trade cell phone.'}

speaker: Ed Gavagan
about_speaker: {0: 'Ed Gavagan was walking down the street in downtown Manhattan when he was the victim of a gang assignment to kill a random stranger. He lives to tell the amazing story.'}

speaker: Rachel Botsman
about_speaker: {0: 'Rachel Botsman is a recognized expert on how collaboration and trust enabled by digital technologies will change the way we live, work, bank and consume.'}

speaker: Andrew McAfee
about_speaker: {0: 'Andrew McAfee studies how information technology affects businesses and society.'}

speaker: Read Montague
about_speaker: {0: 'What does "normal behavior" look like? To find out, Read Montague is imaging thousands of brains at work.'}

speaker: Clay Shirky
about_speaker: {0: 'Clay Shirky argues that the history of the modern world could be rendered as the history of ways of arguing, where changes in media change what sort of arguments are possible -- with deep social and political implications.'}

speaker: John Lloyd
about_speaker: {0: 'John Lloyd helps make some of the cleverest television in the UK. '}

speaker: Ben Goldacre
about_speaker: {0: 'Ben Goldacre unpicks dodgy scientific claims made by scaremongering journalists, dubious government reports, pharmaceutical corporations, PR companies and quacks.'}

speaker: Bahia Shehab
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Fellow Bahia Shehab sends an important message through her street art in Cairo: “You can crush the flowers, but you can’t delay spring."'}

speaker: Aris Venetikidis
about_speaker: {0: 'Aris Venetikidis imagines how maps work with our minds.'}

speaker: Vicki Arroyo
about_speaker: {0: 'Vicki Arroyo uses environmental law and her background in biology and ecology to help prepare for global climate change.'}

speaker: Amy Cuddy
about_speaker: {0: 'Amy Cuddy’s research on body language reveals that we can change other people’s perceptions — and perhaps even our own body chemistry — simply by changing body positions.'}

speaker: Robert Gupta
about_speaker: {0: "Violinist Robert Gupta joined the LA Philharmonic at the age of 19 -- and maintains a passionate parallel interest in neurobiology and mental health issues. He's a TED Senior Fellow."}

speaker: Jason McCue
about_speaker: {0: 'Jason McCue litigates against terrorists, dictators and others who seem above the law, using the legal and judicial system in innovative ways.'}

speaker: Shimon Schocken
about_speaker: {0: 'Shimon Schocken is a computer science professor and dedicated educator.'}

speaker: Thomas P. Campbell
about_speaker: {0: "During his term as director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and now at San Francisco's Fine Arts Museums, Thomas P. Campbell aims to make museum offerings both narrative-driven and accessible.  "}

speaker: Tim Leberecht
about_speaker: {0: 'A humanist in Silicon Valley, Tim Leberecht argues that in a time of artificial intelligence, big data and the quantification of everything, we are losing sight of the importance of the emotional and social aspects of our work.'}

speaker: John Maeda
about_speaker: {0: 'John Maeda, the former president of the Rhode Island School of Design, is dedicated to linking design and technology. Through the software tools, web pages and books he creates, he spreads his philosophy of elegant simplicity.'}

speaker: Ruby Wax
about_speaker: {0: 'Ruby Wax is a loud, funny woman -- who spent much of her comedy career battling depression in silence. Now her work blends mental health advocacy and laughs.'}

speaker: Melissa Marshall
about_speaker: {0: 'Melissa Marshall aims to teach great communication skills to scientists and engineers, so that they can effectively share their work.'}

speaker: Maurizio Seracini
about_speaker: {0: 'Maurizio Seracini uses advanced tools common in engineering and medical labs to unravel centuries-old mysteries of art.'}

speaker: Eddie Obeng
about_speaker: {0: 'Our environment changes faster than we can learn about it, Eddie Obeng says. How do we keep up?'}

speaker: John Wilbanks
about_speaker: {0: 'Imagine the discoveries that could result from a giant pool of freely available health and genomic data. John Wilbanks is working to build it.'}

speaker: Beau Lotto
about_speaker: {0: 'Beau Lotto seeks to pull aside the curtain of why we see what we do in order to create the possibility and agency in deciding what to perceive next.', 1: "Amy O'Toole is a 12-year-old student who helped run a science experiment inspired by Beau Lotto's participative science approach. At age 10 she became one of the youngest people ever to publish a peer-reviewed science paper."}

speaker: Heather Brooke
about_speaker: {0: 'Heather Brooke campaigns for freedom of information, requesting one secret document at a time.'}

speaker: Ryan Merkley
about_speaker: {0: 'Ryan Merkley is the Chief Operating Officer at the Mozilla Foundation, and is dedicated to making the web a more user-friendly place.'}

speaker: Pankaj Ghemawat
about_speaker: {0: "Our world is not flat, says ecnomist Pankaj Ghemawat -- it's at best semi-globalized, with limited interactions between countries and economies."}

speaker: David Pizarro
about_speaker: {0: 'David Pizarro is a psychologist interested in how certain emotions (disgust, fear, anger) affect our moral judgment.'}

speaker: Lemn Sissay
about_speaker: {0: 'An award-winning playwright and popular broadcaster in the UK, as well as the author of five poetry books, Lemn Sissay has a way with words. '}

speaker: Doris Kim Sung
about_speaker: {0: 'Doris Kim Sung is a biology student turned architect interested in thermo-bimetals, smart materials that respond dynamically to temperature change.'}

speaker: Marco Tempest
about_speaker: {0: 'Using technology and an array of special effects, Marco Tempest develops immersive environments that allow viewers to viscerally experience the magic of technology.'}

speaker: Rory Stewart
about_speaker: {0: 'Rory Stewart -- a perpetual pedestrian, a diplomat, an adventurer and an author -- is the member of British Parliament for Penrith and the Border.'}

speaker: Sanjay Pradhan
about_speaker: {0: 'Sanjay Pradhan is vice president of the World Bank Institute, helping leaders in developing countries learn skills for reform, development and good governance.'}

speaker: Emma Teeling
about_speaker: {0: 'Emma Teeling, Director of the Centre for Irish Bat Research, thinks we have a lot to learn from the biology of bats.'}

speaker: Adam Garone
about_speaker: {0: "A co-founder of Movember, Adam Garone aims to change the face of men's health. "}

speaker: Faith Jegede Cole
about_speaker: {0: 'Writer Faith Jegede Cole draws on her experiences growing up with two autistic brothers in order to spread awareness and understanding about this increasingly common diagnosis.'}

speaker: Matt Killingsworth
about_speaker: {0: 'Researcher Matt Killingsworth designs studies that gather data on happiness. One takeaway? "A Wandering Mind Is an Unhappy Mind."'}

speaker: Jake Wood
about_speaker: {0: 'Jake Wood runs Team Rubicon, a nationwide nonprofit that provides military veterans with the opportunity to continue their service by responding to natural disasters and global crises.'}

speaker: Gary Greenberg
about_speaker: {0: 'Gary Greenberg is a photographer, biomedical researcher and inventor intent on giving us all a view of the microscopic wonders all around us.'}

speaker: Georgette Mulheir
about_speaker: {0: 'Georgette Mulheir is a pioneer for the movement to end child abuse in the form of orphanages.'}

speaker: Jeff Hancock
about_speaker: {0: 'Jeff Hancock studies how we interact by email, text message and social media blips, seeking to understand how technology mediates communication.'}

speaker: Julie Burstein
about_speaker: {0: 'As a producer, Julie Burstein builds places to talk (brilliantly) about creative work. Her book "Spark: How Creativity Works" shares what she has learned.'}

speaker: Arunachalam Muruganantham
about_speaker: {0: 'Arunachalam Muruganantham created a system of simple machines to make modern sanitary napkins -- giving millions of women in his home country and around the world access to hygiene.'}

speaker: Hannah Brencher
about_speaker: {0: 'Hannah Brencher believes in the power of pen and paper, and has started a global initiative that encourages strangers to exchange love letters.'}

speaker: Leah Buechley
about_speaker: {0: 'Leah Buechley is an MIT electronics designer who mixes high and low tech to create smart and playful results.'}

speaker: David Binder
about_speaker: {0: 'A Tony Award winner, theater producer David Binder is interested in taking performances off the stage.'}

speaker: Daphne Bavelier
about_speaker: {0: 'Daphne Bavelier studies how the brain adapts to changes in experience, either by nature or by training.'}

speaker: Amos Winter
about_speaker: {0: 'Amos Winter and his team at MIT built the Leveraged Freedom Chair, a cheap lever-powered wheelchair whose design and develop put the user first.'}

speaker: Sleepy Man Banjo Boys
about_speaker: {0: 'The Sleepy Man Banjo Boys is made up of 11-year-old banjo sensation Jonny Mizzone and his brothers Robbie, 14, on fiddle, and Tommy, 15, on guitar.'}

speaker: Louie Schwartzberg
about_speaker: {0: 'Louie Schwartzberg is a cinematographer, director and producer who captures breathtaking images that celebrate life -- revealing connections, universal rhythms, patterns and beauty.'}

speaker: Candy Chang
about_speaker: {0: 'Candy Chang creates art that prompts people to think about their secrets, wishes and hopes -- and then share them. She is a TED Senior Fellow.'}

speaker: Ernesto Sirolli
about_speaker: {0: "Ernesto Sirolli got his start doing aid work in Africa in the 70's -- and quickly realised how ineffective it was."}

speaker: Jonas Eliasson
about_speaker: {0: 'Jonas Eliasson is dedicated to researching transportation flow, analyzing how people think about their commutes and what can influence their travel decisions.'}

speaker: Janine Shepherd
about_speaker: {0: 'Aspiring Olympic skier Janine Shepherd was nearly killed when she was hit by a truck during a training bike ride. Paralysed and immobile for six months, she was given a grim picture for recovery. But not only did she teach herself to walk again— she learned to fly.'}

speaker: Munir Virani
about_speaker: {0: 'Munir Virani is a raptor biologist and wildlife photographer, and Director of the Peregrine Fund Africa Program, devoted to conserving birds of prey.'}

speaker: Paolo Cardini
about_speaker: {0: 'Paolo Cardini is a product designer who asks serious questions about how we live -- and answers them with whimsical and playful designs.'}

speaker: Bobby Ghosh
about_speaker: {0: 'Bobby Ghosh is the Managing Editor at Quartz.'}

speaker: Ludwick Marishane
about_speaker: {0: "Student Ludwick Marishane invented a water-less bathing lotion and was named the 2011 Global Student Entrepreneur of the Year Award -- all because he didn't feel like taking baths."}

speaker: Jeff Smith
about_speaker: {0: "Once an up-and-coming star in the Missouri State Senate, Jeff Smith went to prison for covering up an election law violation. Since his release, he's created a new space for himself as a professor, writer, political commentator and advocate for those he was locked up with. "}

speaker: Nina Tandon
about_speaker: {0: 'Nina Tandon studies ways to use electrical signals to grow artificial tissues for transplants and other therapies.'}

speaker: Lemon Andersen
about_speaker: {0: 'Lemon Andersen is a wordsmith who thinks deeply about the sounds of syllables.'}

speaker: Ellen 't Hoen
about_speaker: {0: "The founder of the Medicines Patent Pool, Ellen 't Hoen works (and makes change) at the place where profit and health collide: patented drugs."}

speaker: Markham Nolan
about_speaker: {0: 'The managing editor of Storyful.com, Markham Nolan has watched journalism evolve from the pursuit of finding facts to the act of verifying those floating in the ether. '}

speaker: Maz Jobrani
about_speaker: {0: 'A founding member of the Axis of Evil Comedy Tour, Iranian-American comedian Maz Jobrani is now touring with his second solo comedy show, Browner and Friendlier.'}

speaker: Marcus Byrne
about_speaker: {0: 'Marcus Byrne is fascinated by the way insects, particularly the intrepid dung beetle, have hardwired solutions to the challenges posed by their environments. Could they help humans solve problems?'}

speaker: Ben Saunders
about_speaker: {0: 'In 2004, Ben Saunders became the youngest person ever to ski solo to the North Pole. In 2013, he set out on another record-breaking expedition, this time to retrace Captain Scott’s ill-fated journey to the South Pole on foot.'}

speaker: Robin Chase
about_speaker: {0: "With Zipcar, Robin Chase introduced car-crazy America to the concept of non-ownership. Now she's flipping that model with Buzzcar, which lets you rent your own auto to your neighbors."}

speaker: Molly Crockett
about_speaker: {0: 'Neuroscientist Molly Crockett studies altruism, morality and value-based decision-making in humans.'}

speaker: Steven Addis
about_speaker: {0: 'Steven Addis is a father and photography buff who, by day, harnesses the power of branding for social change.'}

speaker: Adam Davidson
about_speaker: {0: 'Adam Davidson is the co-host and co-creator of "Planet Money," a weekly podcast and radio feature about the economy.'}

speaker: Ronny Edry
about_speaker: {0: 'Ronny Edry of Israel created The Peace Factory, an online movement for peace in the Middle East, when he posted a Facebook image that declared "Iranians, we will never bomb your country."'}

speaker: Karen Thompson Walker
about_speaker: {0: 'Fiction writer Karen Thompson Walker explores the connection between fear and the imagination.'}

speaker: Hadyn Parry
about_speaker: {0: 'Biotech entrepreneur Hadyn Parry leads a science start-up that develops GM insects to fight dengue fever.'}

speaker: Don Levy
about_speaker: {0: 'Don Levy has served on the frontlines of the digital transformation of entertainment. For 17 years, he led the communications efforts for top visual effects and digital animation studio, Sony Pictures Imageworks. He is fascinated by the magic of movies. '}

speaker: Jonathan Haidt
about_speaker: {0: 'Jonathan Haidt studies how -- and why -- we evolved to be moral and political creatures.'}

speaker: Sue Austin
about_speaker: {0: 'In repurposing her wheelchair to create fantastical art, Sue Austin reshapes how we think about disability.'}

speaker: Jarrett J. Krosoczka
about_speaker: {0: "Jarrett J. Krosoczka is the author/illustrator of countless children's books and graphic novels, including Good Night, Monkey Boy, Baghead and the Lunch Lady series."}

speaker: Boghuma Kabisen Titanji
about_speaker: {0: 'Boghuma Kabisen Titanji set out to research HIV drug resistant viruses. In the process, Titanji met a woman who changed the way she thinks about research subjects.'}

speaker: Andy Puddicombe
about_speaker: {0: 'Mindfulness expert Andy Puddicombe wants to make meditation accessible to everybody: for a happier, healthier you.'}

speaker: Angela Patton
about_speaker: {0: 'Angela Patton is an ambassador for who she calls "at-promise" (as opposed to "at-risk") girls and a serial innovator.'}

speaker: Ellen Jorgensen
about_speaker: {0: 'Ellen Jorgensen is at the leading edge of the do-it-yourself biotechnology movement, bringing scientific exploration and understanding to the public.'}

speaker: Cameron Russell
about_speaker: {0: "Cameron Russell has stomped the runways for Victoria's Secret and Chanel, and has appeared in many magazines. But she is much more than just a pretty face."}

speaker: Richard Weller
about_speaker: {0: 'Dermatologist Richard Weller wants to know: Why are Scots so sick?'}

speaker: Colin Stokes
about_speaker: {0: 'The director of communications for the non-profit Citizen Schools, Colin Stokes thinks deeply about the media he shares with his two young children. '}

speaker: Janine di Giovanni
about_speaker: {0: 'Janine di Giovanni reports from war zones around the world.'}

speaker: Colin Powell
about_speaker: {0: 'General Colin Powell was the first African-American to serve as U.S. Secretary of State.'}

speaker: Steven Schwaitzberg
about_speaker: {0: "Dr. Steven Schwaitzberg is on a mission to teach surgeons around the world to perform minimally invasive surgery. But first, he's had to find the right technology to allow communication across the language barrier.  "}

speaker: Leslie Morgan Steiner
about_speaker: {0: 'Leslie Morgan Steiner is a writer and outspoken advocate for survivors of domestic violence -- which includes herself.'}

speaker: Wingham Rowan
about_speaker: {0: "Wingham Rowan's work bridges the gap between flexible work schedules and modern financial markets. "}

speaker: Mitch Resnick
about_speaker: {0: 'Mitch Resnick directs the Lifelong Kindergarten group at MIT Media Lab, dedicated to helping kids of all ages tinker and experiment with design.'}

speaker: iO Tillett Wright
about_speaker: {0: 'As a child actor, iO Tillett Wright turned his shoes around in the bathroom stall so that people would think he was a boy. As a teenager, he fell in love with both women and men. His life in the gray areas of gender and sexuality deeply inform his work as an artist. '}

speaker: Fahad Al-Attiya
about_speaker: {0: "Fahad Al-Attiya's job is to maintain food security in Qatar, a country that has no water and imports 90 percent of its food."}

speaker: Zahra' Langhi
about_speaker: {0: "Zahra' Langhi is the cofounder of Libyan Women’s Platform for Peace (LWPP), a movement advocating for women’s socio-political empowerment and peace-building."}

speaker: Tyler DeWitt
about_speaker: {0: 'Tyler DeWitt recognizes that textbooks are not the way to get young people interested in science. Instead, he teaches science by making it fun and fantastical.'}

speaker: Cesar Kuriyama
about_speaker: {0: 'Cesar Kuriyama shoots one second of video every day of his life, and edits them together into a montage that prompts him to think how he approaches each day.'}

speaker: Lee Cronin
about_speaker: {0: 'A professor of chemistry, nanoscience and chemical complexity, Lee Cronin and his research group investigate how chemistry can revolutionize modern technology and even create life.'}

speaker: Edi Rama
about_speaker: {0: 'From 2000 to 2011 Edi Rama was the mayor of Tirana, where he implemented a series of reforms to take back the city for the people.'}

speaker: Shabana Basij-Rasikh
about_speaker: {0: 'Shabana Basij-Rasikh helps girls and young women in Afghanistan get an education.'}

speaker: Erik Schlangen
about_speaker: {0: 'Erik Schlangen is a civil engineer and pioneer of experimental micromechanics, who focuses on making industrial materials more durable.'}

speaker: James B. Glattfelder
about_speaker: {0: 'James B. Glattfelder aims to give us a richer, data-driven understanding of the people and interactions that control our global economy. He does this not to push an ideology -- but with the hopes of making the world a better place.'}

speaker: Esther Perel
about_speaker: {0: 'Psychotherapist Esther Perel is changing the conversation on what it means to be in love and have a fulfilling sex life.'}

speaker: Young-ha Kim
about_speaker: {0: 'One of the premiere writers of his generation, Korean novelist Young-ha Kim weaves tales that speak to the thrills and challenges of young Koreans in our increasingly globalized and ever-changing world. '}

speaker: Miguel Nicolelis
about_speaker: {0: 'Miguel Nicolelis explores the limits of the brain-machine interface.'}

speaker: Keith Chen
about_speaker: {0: "Keith Chen's research suggests that the language you speak may impact the way you think about your future."}

speaker: Afra Raymond
about_speaker: {0: 'A leading expert in the fields of property valuation and project management, Afra Raymond is battling the government corruption rampant in his country, Trinidad and Tobago.'}

speaker: Andreas Schleicher
about_speaker: {0: 'What makes a great school system? To find out, Andreas Schleicher administers a test to compare student performance around the world.'}

speaker: Michael Dickinson
about_speaker: {0: "Most people are irritated by the buzzing of a fly's wings. But biologist Michael Dickinson views the sound with a deep sense of wonder."}

speaker: Bruce Feiler
about_speaker: {0: 'Bruce Feiler is the author of "The Secrets of Happy Families," and the writer/presenter of the PBS miniseries "Walking the Bible."'}

speaker: Bruno Maisonnier
about_speaker: {0: 'Bruno Maisonnier founded Aldebaran Robotics, maker of the tiny, compelling humanoid Nao.'}

speaker: Sugata Mitra
about_speaker: {0: 'Educational researcher Sugata Mitra is the winner of the 2013 TED Prize. His wish: Build a School in the Cloud, where children can explore and learn from one another.'}

speaker: Jennifer Granholm
about_speaker: {0: 'A former two-term governor of Michigan, Jennifer M. Granholm makes the case for empowering states to create jobs through a Clean Energy Jobs Race to the Top.\r\n'}

speaker: Amanda Palmer
about_speaker: {0: "Alt-rock icon Amanda Fucking Palmer believes we shouldn't fight the fact that digital content is freely shareable -- and suggests that artists can and should be directly supported by fans."}

speaker: Allan Savory
about_speaker: {0: 'Allan Savory works to promote holistic management in the grasslands of the world.'}

speaker: Edith Widder
about_speaker: {0: 'Edith Widder combines her expertise in research and technological innovation with a commitment to stopping and reversing the degradation of our marine environment. '}

speaker: Ron Finley
about_speaker: {0: 'Ron Finley grows a nourishing food culture in South Central L.A.’s food desert by planting the seeds and tools for healthy eating.'}

speaker: Kakenya Ntaiya
about_speaker: {0: "Dr. Kakenya Ntaiya is the founder and president of Kakenya's Dream, an international nonprofit organization leveraging education to empower girls, end harmful traditional practices and transform communities in rural Kenya."}

speaker: Shane Koyczan
about_speaker: {0: 'Shane Koyczan makes spoken-word poetry and music. His poem "To This Day" is a powerful story of bullying and survival, illustrated by animators from around the world.'}

speaker: Dan Pallotta
about_speaker: {0: 'We dream boldly in the dimension of our doing, but set the bar no higher than stability in our emotional lives. It’s time to dream in multiple dimensions at the same time, says AIDSRide Founder Dan Pallotta. He aims to transform the way society thinks about giving, and being.'}

speaker: David Anderson
about_speaker: {0: 'Through his lab at the California Institute of Technology, David Anderson seeks to find the neural underpinnings of emotions like fear, anxiety and anger.'}

speaker: Stewart Brand
about_speaker: {0: "Since the counterculture '60s, Stewart Brand has been creating our internet-worked world. Now, with biotech accelerating four times faster than digital technology, Stewart Brand has a bold new plan ..."}

speaker: Bono
about_speaker: {0: 'Bono, the lead singer of U2, uses his celebrity to fight for social justice worldwide: to end hunger, poverty and disease, especially in Africa. His nonprofit ONE raises awareness via media, policy and calls to action.'}

speaker: Catarina Mota
about_speaker: {0: 'A TEDGlobal Fellow, Catarina Mota plays with "smart materials" -- like shape-memory alloys and piezoelectric structures that react to voltage -- and encourages others to do so too.'}

speaker: Danny Hillis
about_speaker: {0: 'Inventor, scientist, author, engineer -- over his broad career, Danny Hillis has turned his ever-searching brain on an array of subjects, with surprising results.'}

speaker: Elon Musk
about_speaker: {0: 'Elon Musk is the CEO and product architect of Tesla Motors and the CEO/CTO of Space Exploration Technologies (SpaceX).'}

speaker: Hyeonseo Lee
about_speaker: {0: 'As a child growing up in North Korea, Hyeonseo Lee thoght her country was the "best on the planet." It wasn\'t until the famine of the 90s that she began to wonder. She escaped the country at 17-years-old to begin a life in hiding as a refugee in China. Hers is a harrowing, personal tale of survival and hope -- and a powerful reminder of those who face constant danger, even when the border is far behind.'}

speaker: Francis Collins
about_speaker: {0: "A key player in the US' new brain-mapping project, Francis Collins is director of the National Institutes of Health. "}

speaker: Eric Whitacre
about_speaker: {0: 'After creating and conducting a worldwide virtual choir on YouTube, Eric Whitacre is now touring with an astonishing live choir.'}

speaker: Jessica Green
about_speaker: {0: 'Jessica Green wants people to understand the important role microbes play in every facet of our lives: climate change, building ecosystems, human health, even roller derby -- using nontraditional tools like art, animation and film to help people visualize the invisible world.'}

speaker: Mark Shaw
about_speaker: {0: 'Mark Shaw develops technologies to contain hazardous waste, storm water and radioactives. '}

speaker: Richard Turere
about_speaker: {0: 'Young inventor Richard Turere invented "lion lights," an elegant way to protect his family\'s cattle from lion attacks.'}

speaker: Colin Camerer
about_speaker: {0: 'Colin Camerer is a leading behavioral economist who studies the psychological and neural bases of choice and strategic decision-making.'}

speaker: Katherine Kuchenbecker
about_speaker: {0: 'Katherine Kuchenbecker works on incorporating the sense of touch directly into virtual objects. Imagine being able to feel textures on your digital screens.'}

speaker: Kees Moeliker
about_speaker: {0: 'Kees Moeliker writes and speaks about natural history, especially birds and remarkable animal behavior, as well as improbable research and science-communication-with-a-laugh.'}

speaker: Sanjay Dastoor
about_speaker: {0: "Sanjay Dastoor is the co-founder of Boosted Boards, a startup that aims to build the world's lightest electric vehicles."}

speaker: Lawrence Lessig
about_speaker: {0: "Lawrence Lessig has already transformed intellectual-property law with his Creative Commons innovation. Now he's focused on an even bigger problem: The US' broken political system."}

speaker: Ken Jennings
about_speaker: {0: 'Ken Jennings holds the record for most consecutive wins on the classic American trivia game show, Jeopardy.'}

speaker: Freeman Hrabowski
about_speaker: {0: 'During his 20-year tenure as president of UMBC, Freeman Hrabowski has helped students of all backgrounds pursue degrees in arts, humanities and the sciences.'}

speaker: Keller Rinaudo
about_speaker: {0: "Keller Rinaudo is CEO and co-founder of Zipline, building drone delivery for global public health customers. (He's also co-founder of Romotive, makers of the tiny robot, Romo.)"}

speaker: Dan Ariely
about_speaker: {0: 'The dismal science of economics is not as firmly grounded in actual behavior as was once supposed. In "Predictably Irrational," Dan Ariely told us why.'}

speaker: Eric Dishman
about_speaker: {0: 'Eric Dishman does health care research for Intel -- studying how new technology can solve big problems in the system for the sick, the aging and, well, all of us.'}

speaker: Laura Snyder
about_speaker: {0: 'Laura Snyder weaves tales of Victorian-era scientists that have been described as “fit for Masterpiece Theater.”'}

speaker: Rose George
about_speaker: {0: "Rose George looks deeply into topics that are unseen but fundamental, whether that's sewers or latrines or massive container ships or pirate hostages or menstrual hygiene."}

speaker: Thomas Insel
about_speaker: {0: 'The Director of the National Institute of Mental Health, Thomas Insel supports research that will help us understand, treat and even prevent mental disorders.'}

speaker: Joshua Prager
about_speaker: {0: 'Joshua Prager’s journalism unravels historical secrets -- and his own.'}

speaker: Andres Lozano
about_speaker: {0: 'The chair of neurosurgery at the University of Toronto, Andres Lozano has pioneered the use of deep brain stimulation for treating Parkinson’s, depression, anorexia and Alzheimer’s disease.'}

speaker: BLACK
about_speaker: {0: 'Twice the world yo-yo champion, BLACK mixes dance, sport and performance to create unforgettable yo-yo moments.'}

speaker: John McWhorter
about_speaker: {0: 'Linguist John McWhorter thinks about language in relation to race, politics and our shared cultural history.'}

speaker: Erik Brynjolfsson
about_speaker: {0: 'Erik Brynjolfsson examines the effects of information technologies on business strategy, productivity and employment.'}

speaker: Robert J. Gordon
about_speaker: {0: 'Robert J. Gordon is among the most influential macroeconomists in the world. And the big picture he sees is not altogether rosy.'}

speaker: Michael Stevens
about_speaker: {0: 'Michael Stevens is the creator and host of Vsauce, an educational YouTube channel that addresses scientific oddities, like "Is Your Red the Same as My Red?"'}

speaker: Jennifer Healey
about_speaker: {0: 'A research scientist at Intel, Jennifer Healey develops the mobile internet devices of the future. '}

speaker: David Pogue
about_speaker: {0: 'David Pogue is the personal technology columnist for the New York Times and a tech correspondent for CBS News. He\'s also one of the world\'s bestselling how-to authors, with titles in the For Dummies series and his own line of "Missing Manual" books. '}

speaker: Nilofer Merchant
about_speaker: {0: 'Business innovator Nilofer Merchant thinks deeply about the frameworks, strategies and cultural values of companies.'}

speaker: Taylor Wilson
about_speaker: {0: 'At 14, Taylor Wilson became the youngest person to achieve fusion -- with a reactor born in his garage. Now he wants to save our seaports from nuclear terror.'}

speaker: Sebastião Salgado
about_speaker: {0: 'Sebastião Salgado captures the dignity of the dispossessed through large-scale, long-term projects.'}

speaker: Juan Enriquez
about_speaker: {0: 'Juan Enriquez thinks and writes about the profound changes that genomics and brain research will bring about in business, technology, politics and society.'}

speaker: Rita F. Pierson
about_speaker: {0: 'Rita F. Pierson spent her entire life in or around the classroom, having followed both her parents and grandparents into a career as an educator. '}

speaker: Timothy Bartik
about_speaker: {0: 'The author of "Investing in Kids," Timothy Bartik studies state and local economies -- and analyzes the benefits of preschool as an economic development program.'}

speaker: ShaoLan Hsueh
about_speaker: {0: "ShaoLan want to help people understand China's culture and language, and to bridge the gap between East and West."}

speaker: Pearl Arredondo
about_speaker: {0: 'Pearl Arredondo helped establish a pilot middle school that teaches students to be good communicators in the 21st century.'}

speaker: Geoffrey Canada
about_speaker: {0: 'Geoffrey Canada has spent decades as head of the Harlem Children’s Zone, which supports kids from birth through college in order to break the cycle of poverty.'}

speaker: Malcolm London
about_speaker: {0: 'Young spoken-word poet Malcolm London has been called the "Gil Scott-Heron of this generation" (by Cornel West). His feisty, passionate performances take on the issues of the day, including the Chicago education system in which he grew up.'}

speaker: Ramsey Musallam
about_speaker: {0: 'As a high school chemistry teacher, Ramsey Musallam expands curiosity in the classroom through multimedia and new technology.'}

speaker: Bill Gates
about_speaker: {0: "A passionate techie and a shrewd businessman, Bill Gates changed the world while leading Microsoft to dizzying success. Now he's doing it again with his own style of philanthropy and passion for innovation."}

speaker: Angela Lee Duckworth
about_speaker: {0: 'At the University of Pennsylvania, Angela Lee Duckworth studies intangible concepts such as self-control and grit to determine how they might predict both academic and professional success.'}

speaker: Sir Ken Robinson
about_speaker: {0: "Creativity expert Sir Ken Robinson challenges the way we're educating our children. He champions a radical rethink of our school systems, to cultivate creativity and acknowledge multiple types of intelligence. "}

speaker: Meg Jay
about_speaker: {0: 'In her book "The Defining Decade," Meg Jay suggests that many twentysomethings feel trivialized during what is actually the most transformative — and defining — period of our adult lives.'}

speaker: Maria Bezaitis
about_speaker: {0: 'A principal engineer at Intel, Maria Bezaitis focuses on how constellations of personal data can form new business models. '}

speaker: Liu Bolin
about_speaker: {0: 'Beijing-based artist Liu Bolin silently comments on modern sociopolitical conditions by disappearing into his art.'}

speaker: Jay Silver
about_speaker: {0: "Jay Silver and Eric Rosenbaum's MaKey MaKey kit lets you turn everyday objects into computer interfaces -- inspiring both fun and practical new inventions."}

speaker: Sergey Brin
about_speaker: {0: 'Sergey Brin is half of the team that founded Google.'}

speaker: Peter Singer
about_speaker: {0: 'Sometimes controversial, always practical ethicist Peter Singer stirs public debate about morality, from animal welfare to global poverty.'}

speaker: Phil Hansen
about_speaker: {0: 'Taking a cue from his own artistic journey, Phil Hansen challenges us to spark our creativity by thinking inside the box.'}

speaker: Judy MacDonald Johnston
about_speaker: {0: "By day, Judy MacDonald Johnston develops children's reading programs. By night, she helps others maintain their quality of life as they near death."}

speaker: Alastair Parvin
about_speaker: {0: 'Alastair Parvin believes in making architecture accessible to 100 percent of the population.'}

speaker: Ji-Hae Park
about_speaker: {0: 'Ji-Hae Park spreads the joy of classical to music to those who might not otherwise hear it -- and in the process shows that you can rock out on the violin.'}

speaker: Paola Antonelli
about_speaker: {0: "Paola Antonelli is on a mission to introduce -- and explain -- design to the world. With her shows at New York's Museum of Modern Art, she celebrates design's presence in every part of life."}

speaker: Jackson Katz
about_speaker: {0: "Jackson Katz asks a very important question that gets at the root of why sexual abuse, rape and domestic abuse remain a problem: What's going on with men? "}

speaker: Hendrik Poinar
about_speaker: {0: 'Hendrik Poinar is a geneticist and biological anthropologist who focuses on extracting ancient DNA. He currently has his sights set on sequencing the genome of the woolly mammoth -- and cloning it.'}

speaker: Lisa Bu
about_speaker: {0: 'Lisa Bu has built a career helping people find great stories to listen to. Now she tells her own story.'}

speaker: Andrew Solomon
about_speaker: {0: 'Andrew Solomon writes about politics, culture and psychology. '}

speaker: Alex Laskey
about_speaker: {0: 'Alex Laskey helps power companies to help their customers cut down -- using data analysis, marketing and a pinch of psychology.'}

speaker: Anas Aremeyaw Anas
about_speaker: {0: 'Anas Aremeyaw Anas is a Ghanaian undercover journalist and private eye who gathers hard evidence of crime and corruption, putting the perpetrators behind bars. '}

speaker: Denise Herzing
about_speaker: {0: 'Denise Herzing has spent almost three decades researching and communicating with wild dolphins in their natural setting and on their own terms. The book "Dolphin Diaries" tells her remarkable story.'}

speaker: Martin Villeneuve
about_speaker: {0: 'In his film "Mars et Avril," Martin Villeneuve brings his sci-fi romance graphic novel to glorious life.'}

speaker: Andrew McAfee
about_speaker: {0: 'Andrew McAfee studies how information technology affects businesses and society.'}

speaker: Raffaello D'Andrea
about_speaker: {0: "Raffaello D'Andrea explores the possibilities of autonomous technology by collaborating with artists, engineers and entrepreneurs."}

speaker: George Papandreou
about_speaker: {0: 'George Papandreou draws on lessons learned from the Greek debt crisis as he helps guide the EU through difficult waters.'}

speaker: Daniel Suarez
about_speaker: {0: 'Daniel Suarez concocts thrilling reads from terrifying (and not-so-farfetched) near-future scenarios.'}

speaker: Manal al-Sharif

speaker: Didier Sornette

speaker: Juliana Rotich

speaker: Joseph Kim

speaker: Paul Pholeros

speaker: Camille Seaman

speaker: Lesley Hazleton

speaker: Peter Attia
about_speaker: {0: 'Both a surgeon and a self-experimenter, Peter Attia hopes to ease the diabetes epidemic by challenging what we think we know and improving the scientific rigor in nutrition and obesity research. '}

speaker: Bob Mankoff
about_speaker: {0: 'Bob Mankoff is the cartoon editor of The New Yorker, as well as an accomplished cartoonist in his own right.'}

speaker: Michael Archer

speaker: Rodney Brooks

speaker: Joel Selanikio

speaker: Jinha Lee
about_speaker: {0: 'Jinha Lee wants to weave digital computing into the flow of our physical reality.'}

speaker: Sleepy Man Banjo Boys
about_speaker: {0: 'The Sleepy Man Banjo Boys is made up of 11-year-old banjo sensation Jonny Mizzone and his brothers Robbie, 14, on fiddle, and Tommy, 15, on guitar.'}

speaker: Charmian Gooch
about_speaker: {0: 'Charmian Gooch is the 2014 TED Prize winner. At Global Witness, she exposes how a global architecture of corruption is woven into the extraction and exploitation of natural resources.'}

speaker: Michael Green
about_speaker: {0: 'Michael Green wants to solve architecture’s biggest challenge -- meeting worldwide housing demand without increasing carbon emissions -- by building with carbon-sequestering wood instead of concrete and steel.'}

speaker: Diana Reiss
about_speaker: {0: 'Diana Reiss studies animal cognition, and has found that bottlenose dolphins (and Asian elephants) can recognize themselves in the mirror.', 1: 'Peter Gabriel writes incredible songs but, as the co-founder of WITNESS and TheElders.org, is also a powerful human rights advocate.', 2: 'As Director of MIT’s Center for Bits and Atoms, Neil Gershenfeld explores the boundaries between the digital and physical worlds.', 3: 'Vint Cerf, now the chief Internet evangelist at Google, helped lay the foundations for the internet as we know it more than 30 years ago.'}

speaker: Jack Andraka
about_speaker: {0: 'A paper on carbon nanotubes, a biology lecture on antibodies and a flash of insight led 15-year-old Jack Andraka to design a cheaper, more sensitive cancer detector.'}

speaker: Al Vernacchio
about_speaker: {0: 'In his 12th-grade Sexuality and Society class, Al Vernacchio speaks honestly and positively about human sexuality.'}

speaker: Bernie Krause
about_speaker: {0: "Bernie Krause's legendary soundscapes uncover nature’s rich sonic tapestry -- along with some unexpected results."}

speaker: Gavin Pretor-Pinney

speaker: Pico Iyer
about_speaker: {0: 'Novelist and nonfiction author Pico Iyer writes on subjects ranging from the Cuban Revolution to Islamic mysticism, from Graham Greene to forgotten nations and the 21st-century global order.'}

speaker: Tom Thum

speaker: John Searle
about_speaker: {0: 'John Searle has made countless contributions to contemporary thinking about consciousness, language, artificial intelligence and rationality itself.'}

speaker: Kate Stone
about_speaker: {0: 'At Novalia, Kate Stone and her team use ordinary printing presses to manufacture interactive electronics, which combine touch-sensitive ink technology and printed circuits into unique and cost-effective products.'}

speaker: Roberto D'Angelo + Francesca Fedeli
about_speaker: {0: "Roberto D'Angelo and Francesca Fedeli created the social enterprise FightTheStroke.org to open up a dialogue about the devastating effects of strokes at a young age. This issue is important to them for a simple reason: because they've been through it themselves with their son Mario.\r\n"}

speaker: Paul Kemp-Robertson

speaker: Tania Luna

speaker: Bastian Schaefer

speaker: Eli Beer

speaker: Julie Taymor
about_speaker: {0: 'Julie Taymor is a film, theater and opera director. She is known for lavish movies such as Frida and for her hit Broadway musicals, The Lion King and Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark.'}

speaker: Peter van Manen

speaker: Beardyman

speaker: Daniel H. Cohen
about_speaker: {0: 'Philosopher Daniel H. Cohen studies language and the way we argue through reason.'}

speaker: Jinsop Lee

speaker: Saki Mafundikwa
about_speaker: {0: 'Saki Mafundikwa wrote the book on Africa’s graphic design heritage -- then opened a school of graphic arts in his native Zimbabwe. '}

speaker: Eleanor Longden
about_speaker: {0: 'Eleanor Longden overcame her diagnosis of  schizophrenia to earn a master’s in psychology and demonstrate that the voices in her head were “a sane reaction to insane circumstances.”'}

speaker: Derek Paravicini
about_speaker: {0: 'Pianist Derek Paravicini understands music systematically. Once a child prodigy, he’s matured into a creative musician, able to reimagine songs in ways few can. ', 1: 'A composer and music teacher who has long worked with children with special needs, Adam Ockelford is interested in the psychology of music. '}

speaker: Margaret Heffernan

speaker: Shigeru Ban

speaker: Russell Foster

speaker: Steve Ramirez
about_speaker: {0: 'When Steve Ramirez published his latest study in Science, it caused a media frenzy. Why? Because the paper was on implanting false memories in the brains of mice.', 1: 'In his groundbreaking work, Xu Liu investigated how to activate and deactivate specific memories in mice.'}

speaker: May El-Khalil

speaker: Adam Spencer
about_speaker: {0: "Radio host Adam Spencer fills Sydney's drive-time mornings with smart math and science talk."}

speaker: Kelly McGonigal

speaker: Alexa Meade

speaker: George Monbiot

speaker: Jake Barton

speaker: Ron McCallum

speaker: Apollo Robbins

speaker: James Lyne

speaker: Marla Spivak
about_speaker: {0: 'Marla Spivak researches bees’ behavior and biology in an effort to preserve this threatened, but ecologically essential, insect.'}

speaker: Eric Berlow
about_speaker: {0: 'TED Senior Fellow Eric Berlow studies ecology and networks, exposing the interconnectedness of our ecosystems with climate change, government, corporations and more. speaker: Kevin Breel

speaker: Malcolm Gladwell

speaker: Kelli Swazey
about_speaker: {0: 'Kelli Swazey examines how religious and spiritual practices form group identity, and play a vital role in structuring the interactions of individuals within a culture. '}

speaker: Amy Webb
about_speaker: {0: 'Amy Webb is a futurist and founder of the Future Today Institute, and is the award-winning author of three books, including “Data: A Love Story” and “The Signals Are Talking: Why Today’s Fringe Is Tomorrow’s Mainstream.”'}

speaker: Fabian Oefner
about_speaker: {0: 'Fabian Oefner creates stunning visual representations of natural forces.'}

speaker: Jason Pontin

speaker: Michael Porter

speaker: Michael Sandel

speaker: Jeff Speck

speaker: Amanda Bennett

speaker: Alessandro Acquisti

about_speaker: {0: 'In his compelling stage works, Hetain Patel uses powerful imagery and storytelling to examine questions of identity.', 1: "Yuyu Rau's dance skills span a wide range, from ballet to contemporary to Chinese classical."}

speaker: Steve Howard

speaker: Gian Giudice

speaker: Stefan Larsson

speaker: Lian Pin Koh

speaker: Joe Kowan
